119501.name: Svenska Fåglar
119501.description:
A old swedish card game that consist of 100 cards with birds that can be found in sweden. The goal of the game is to collect group of cards with birds related to each other. This is done by sending a card you do not want to the player next to you and at the same time you get one from the other opponent.

In the game there is also a map of 325 birds that is recommendet to be used in biologyclasses in school.

119502.name: Tangram Race
119502.description:
From the publisher:
Tangram is a classic seven-piece dissection puzzle from China. In Tangram Race, each player has a set of tangram pieces. Pick a task card randomly and try to form the shape shown in the card. The first player to do so gets the card, and the first player to collect five task cards, wins the game!
With three difficulty levels, Tangram Race is suitable for both beginners and advanced players. The game includes 200 tasks and solutions.

119503.description: ΤΑ ΜΑΓΙΚΑ ΠΕΤΡΑΔΙΑ (MAGIC GEMS) is an abstract board game that three players try to through pass 10 gems to the other side of the board by dice rolling. The player who first takes all his gems to the other side is the winner.
119503.name: ΤΑ ΜΑΓΙΚΑ ΠΕΤΡΑΔΙΑ

119504.description:
Wolf im Schafspelz is a fast-paced dice game in which you must quickly evaluate the roll of the dice and toss the right card in the right box. The faster you are, the more points you score – assuming you're correct, of course.

In the basic game, each player holds a wool card and the two halves of the box are laid face-up on the table, one showing a sheep in the bottom and the other a wolf. Players roll five or seven animal dice, depending on the number of players, then they try to scan the dice quickly to see which animal group – the sheep or wolves – are in the majority so that they can through their wool card in that box. Players who do so score 0-3 chips, depending on the number of players and how quickly they threw in their card; anyone tossing in the wrong box loses one chip. The first player to collect ten chips wins.

In the advanced game, a spice/wool die is rolled with the animal dice, and players need to throw the appropriate card – spice or wool – into the appropriate box. In the elite game, a blue animal die comes into play. If the blue animal die is part of the sheep/wolf majority, then game play is identical to the advanced game for that round; if not, then players must throw the symbol not showing on the spice/wool die into the right box.

One final variant can be used with all three levels of play: When the sheep are in the majority, those who score in the round receive a sheep chip; when the wolves are ascendant, they receive a wolf chip. The winner is the first player to collect both five sheep chips and five wolf chips.
119504.name: Wolf im Schafspelz

119505.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 14 - Jan 2001)
119505.description: This issue contains the adventure "Väterchen Frost" which was the 3rd place at the advneture contest for "Hannover Spielt 2000" and the scenario "Brennede Türme"

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee
119506.description:
Early in the history of the United States, slavery was an institution that seemed unmovable but with efforts of men and women across the country, it was toppled. In Freedom: The Underground Railroad, players are working to build up the strength of the Abolitionist movement through the use of notable figures and pivotal events. By raising support for the cause and moving slaves to freedom in Canada, the minds of Americans can be changed and the institution of slavery can be brought down.

Freedom is a card-driven, cooperative game for one to four players in which the group is working for the abolitionist movement to help bring an end to slavery in the United States. The players use a combination of cards, which feature figures and events spanning from Early Independence until the Civil War, along with action tokens and the benefits of their role to impact the game.

Players need to strike the right balance between freeing slaves from plantations in the south and raising funds which are desperately needed to allow the group to continue their abolitionist activities as well as strengthen the cause.

The goal is not easy and in addition to people and events that can have a negative impact on the group's progress, there are also slave catchers roaming the board, reacting to the movements of the slaves on the board and hoping to catch the runaway slaves and send them back to the plantations.

Through careful planning and working together, the group might see an end to slavery in their time.
119506.name: Freedom: The Underground Railroad
boardgameexpansion: Freedom: The Underground Railroad – Promo Cards
boardgameaccessory: Freedom: The Underground Railroad – Lantern Turn Marker
Freedom: The Underground Railroad – Slave Catcher Playing Pieces
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 113 - Freedom: The Underground Railroad
Episode 21 -- Rant! Coffee! Tournament!
Episode 24 -- All you need is a Spare Chair at the Doctor's Office
Episode 8: Super Dungeon Explore: Forgotten King, Timecop, and Battleheart: Legacy
Episode Charlie - 2016 Retrospective
Garrett's Games 428 - Meeplefest 2014 Night 2, Part 2
GenCon 2013 - Freedom: The Underground Railroad
HLG 6: Samen
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form
OBG 124: Places to Build and People to Kill
Podcast #11: All Your Broken Monsters
Strange Assembly 152 - Not Constantinople
TDT # 352 - Exploration Games
The Board Game Interview Room with Uwe Eickert
The Boardgame Review Room: Freedom - The Underground Railroad
The Good, The Board, and the Alpha Gamer: Episode 31 Cooperative Games
The Long View: Freedom the Underground Railroad
The Spiel #190 - Follow The Drinkin' Gourd
Vox Republica 137: Award Season

119507.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 13 - Sep 2000)
119507.description: This issue contains the scenario "Die Rückkehr" and the 2nd part of the scenario "Der dreifache Turm" and the adventure "Das Kind der Sonne"

119508.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 12 - Mar 2000)
119508.description: This issue contains the 1st part of the adventure "Amanthallas- Die Fremden" and the adventure "Die Rote Frenja"

119509.name: 'ABC' The One-Page Role-Playing Game
119509.description:
From the Footnote:

'ABC' is an adventure role-playing game for players who prefer improvisation and minimal rules. Written by C.J. Gledhill, with inspiration from S. J. Ross's Risus as well as The One Ring, Trail of Cthulhu, Traveller and Tunnels & Trolls.

119510.name: Rescue (1982)
119510.description:
From the in-game instructions:

The aim of the game is to rescue a Princess who is held captive in a Castle and lead her to the safety of your own base.

There are three stages to the game. These are:

STAGE 1. You move around a playing area searching for the objects that will help you to find the Castle and then to gain entrance in order to find the Princess.

STAGE 2. You search the Castle and, if successful rescue the Princess.

STAGE 3. Return to the Playing area and lead her to your own Base.

119511.name: CTU: Marine Sharpshooter
119511.description:
From the back of the box:

Dropped behind enemy lines, you have uncovered a terrorist plan to construct a nuclear weapon and detonate it on American soil. You must follow the plot from the deserts of Afghanistan through the Russian winter and into the jungles of a small south pacific island. Armed with an arsenal of precision sniper weaponry, your only assistance is provided by your observer, your eyes, ears and close quarters machine gun. Make every shot count, your country is depending on it.

119512.description:
From publisher:

Aliens vs Boy Scouts (Prepared? Always be prepared!) is a dynamic game for a large group of friends. Two teams are at a standoff: the aliens steal the boy scouts during the “night” phase of the game, and the boy scouts vote to eliminate one player during each of the “day” phases in an attempt to neutralize the aliens. The game develops diplomatic skills as well as analytical and deductive thinking. Based on the widely known game Mafia, Aliens vs. Boy Scouts offers a different plot together with expanded gaming abilities. The game has a number of advantages over its free print-n-play prototype:

- originally illustrated cards
- new gaming elements: “objects” and “events”
- a different environment: one without murder and criminal activity
- other useful materials: a referee chart and voting tokens
119512.name: Чужие против пионеров

119513.name: Dreadmire Bonus Material
119513.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here you will find verisimilitude: rules covering swamp ecology, hazards, disease, juju, regional encounter tables, descriptions of harried villages, as well as details of nearly three hundred new creatures, such as mire giants, weregators, carnivorous plants, phantom mosquitoes, marsh elementals, monstrous amphibians, fungus demons, alligataurs, cannibal elves, evil druids, mud dwarves, bayou halflings, plant swarms, the disgusting anthroaches, and a terrifying goliath pelican.

Dreadmire Bonus Material contains:
28 New Armors
24 New Weapon Types
16 New Feats
12 New Monsters
8 New Magic Items
8 New Spells
7 New Deities & Servants
7 New Classes
1 New Skill

4 Addendums to Dreadmire:

Dread Pharmacopoeia
Hool Shipwright Guild
The Longbow Workhouses
Tatau Warrior Companion

119514.name: The Realm of Arkular
119514.description:
From Introduction:

The Realm of Arkular is a fantasy campaign setting. It comes complete with new races, nations, and most of all, maps. Counting the cover, which shows the world on which Arkular rests, there are 14 different maps, showing everything from global views to continents, nations to regions, and cities to villages.

But the Realm of Arkular is more than just a fantasy setting. The maps are fully customizable, and the names can change with a click and a few keystrokes. Simply position your mouse pointer over a location name, click, and you can totally rename any location on the entire continent. There are maps for abandoned hunting lodges, cities and towns, small regions and large. You can use these maps for your own campaign ideas, renaming and repurposing the entire project to fit your own setting.

119515.name: Spotlight: Ordinary Mugshots
119515.description:
From Introduction:

Ordinary Mugshots is a d20 Modern gaming aid designed to reduce GM prep time and provide layout-friendly stat blocks that are suitable for use in published settings, adventures, and other d20 Modern supplements. All of these Ordinaries were created using the RPGObjects Modern System Character Generator and the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game as a guide. The Ordinaries listed in this book are classified according to the 19 Occupations given in the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game.

119516.name: 101 Pirate and Privateer Traits
119516.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Avast! This be about campaigning with the scourges o' the seven seas, matey.

All o' history since the dawn of time, thar be pirates. Julius Caesar fought 'em, and ta this day pirates be takin' ships off the coasts of lawless kingdoms. But here we be speakin' about the campaign traits of pirates and privateers of yar realm of fantasy. Arrh, they be dashing villains and heroes who live free on the open sea, with a parrot (or monkey) on the shoulder and a chest full o' gold, along with letters of marque. They be fond o' drinking and prone ta fights, out to live "a short life and a merry one."

Brought ta ye by the same landlubbing author o' such critically acclaimed works as 101 New Skill Uses and The Secrets of the Gunslinger, 101 Pirate and Privateer Traits provides ye an armada o' new options ta sake the thirst of the most fervent corsair while allowing ye ta keep ta yar vision of a character upon the high seas!

119517.name: 10 Luckbringer Feats
119517.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Lucky Snack!

Sometimes you want to sit down to a full meal of archetypes, base classes, feats, magic items, NPCs, prestige classes, traits, classes, spells, and sometimes you just want a cheap quick and easy snack for a buck. To feed your craving Rite Publishing presents the"10 Series" which will present 10 pieces for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This first time out we bring you 10 new feats to supplement the critically acclaimed new base class the luckbringer (The Secrets of the Luckbringer).


Advantageous Strike: Your very nature can manipulate probabilities so as to hit just the right spot.
Auspicious Escape: You use your ability to alter probabilities, your body, or the flow of time to overcome adversity (also useful with the taskshaper, time thief, and time warden base classes)
Fortunate Fate: Even fate favors the outcome of your life
Karmic Reaction: You can spend the karma you have earned to protect yourself.
Last-Minute Gamble: You use up all the luck you have in one final effort to take down a foe.
Martial Kismet: The very forces of fate themselves seem to guide your attacks.
Motion of the Moirai: The Fates themselves bless your movements, and curse the movements of your foes.
Opportunity Knocks Twice: You always seem to find the right opportunity to attack an foe.
Woe Unto Him: You have a great gift for calling down ill fortune.

119518.name: #30 Haunts for Kaidan
119518.description:
Publisher's blurb:

he Haunts of Japanese Horror!

Kaidan—whose very name means "ghost story" in Japanese—is a mist-shrouded realm of exotic races, oni demons, and yurei ghosts, ruled by an undying imperial court enforced by ruthless samurai with all social castes bound to an endless cycle of twisted reincarnation. The empire of Kaidan is, by definition, haunted. Included in this tome are 30 haunts and several unique and horrifying undead variants, all inspired by classic Japanese ghost stories.

This volume is organized in nine creepy storylines to help you envision the horrors that await your adventuring party in the dark realm of Kaidan. Brought to you by T.H. Gulliver, the same designer that brought you the award-winning #30 Haunts for Objects (DieHard GameFan's best supplement for 2011). This product brings something to the game it has never had before, haunts that are embeded in the very nature of the realm.

119519.name: The Secrets of the Oracle
119519.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I Foretold You So!

The power of the oracle, be it gift or curse? Regardless these chosen vessels of divine power delve ever deeper into their sacred mysteries. Some of these mysteries lead to the discoveries of new mysteries, new curses, and new archetypes for the initiates to explore. Read on and learn The Secrets of the Oracle!

Within this product you will find:


Six new mysteries (Arcana, Darkness, Luck, Primeval, Rot, and Sound) to help add additional atmosphere of mysticism to your oracle.
Six new oracle curses (Bad luck, Emotionless, Hated, Simpleminded, Technical Ineptitude, and Voices) to add exotic benefits and hindrances to your oracles status of being touched by overwhelming divine power.
Six new archetypes (Ascetic, Entheogenecist, Crone, Mad Prophet, Tribal, Shaman, Wanderer) to help you find a unique and original vision to your character.

119520.name: Ice Tunnels
119520.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jonathan Roberts cartographer for Kobold Quarterly, The Breaking of Forstor Nagar, and Adventures in the Hyborian Age, presents another Fantastic Map: Ice Tunnels.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out the battlemap at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format or A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. High-Resolution JPEGs of the maps with and without grids. The file also contains a MapTool file set up for quick use in a 4E, PFRPG, or any OGL game. The MapTool file requires MapTool 1.3b86 or newer to work.

119521.name: City Gates
119521.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jonathan Roberts cartographer for Kobold Quarterly, The Breaking of Forstor Nagar, and Adventures in the Hyborian Age, presents another Fantastic Map: City Gates.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out the battlemap at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format or A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. High-Resolution JPEGs of the maps with and without grids. The file also contains a MapTool file set up for quick use in a 4E, PFRPG, or any OGL game. The MapTool file requires MapTool 1.3b86 or newer to work.

119522.name: Key Encounters: The Volcanic Shrine
119522.description:
From publisher blurb:

Key Encounters: The Volcanic Shrine combines the writing and imagination of fan favorite Monte Cook with SkeletonKey Games' best selling miniatures-scale tiles to bring a detailed encounter to your table top. The Volcanic Shrine is a major encounter for fantasy d20 games that can be built with the 20 brand-new, custom designed miniatures-scale tiles included in the product. The encounter details the link between a massive lake of lava deep underground and the Elemental Plane of Fire itself. This encounter could be used as the center point of an entire adventure involving creatures of flame and the evil plot of a dark elemental creature known as Kaliastrix. The 20 tiles can be used to build other volcanic pools and lakes and works well with other SkeletonKey Games tile sets, including Volcanic Caves Vol. 1 and 2. The Volcanic Shrine includes guidelines for incorporating the encounter into a larger context, tips on running an encounter with lava dangers all around, and a full page encounter map of the shrine itself.

119523.name: The Secrets of Forgotten Magic Items
119523.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Potions, Scrolls, and Runes!

Delve into wonders lost to antiquity and hidden from the eyes of men-discover The Secrets of Forgotten Magic Items.

Craft overloaded potions to fling at enemies, or contingent potions which patiently wait for the proper situation. Place precious liquids in enchanted flasks and give your potions an extra kick. Scribe Dweomer Sigil scrolls to subtly augment spells or fashion delicately folded Arcanami creatures-the artistic, animated manifestations of spells. Decipher the art of Cruth Galdr runes and invest items and structures with elegant magical effects like the Fulminating Rune or the Rune of Hidden Spaces.

The Secrets of Forgotten Magic Items comes packed with feats like Flask Enchanter Trismegistus or Overloading Master, dozens of items, an archetype, a bloodline, a subdomain, a monster and even an artifact.

119524.name: Five Room Dungeon: The Rabbit Hole
119524.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How Deep Does It Go?

There is more to Coliseum Morpheuon than the Khan of Nightmares and the one hundred wishes of the Damnation Epoch. The Tarnished Souk brings souls from across the planes to its questionable market in search of riches and power. Groups vie for influence and advantage on and off the sands of the arena. Beneath the surface and hidden within the intrigues of shadowy factions, there are secrets.

Secrets with power.
Secrets to die for.
Secrets soaked in blood.

Can you bend the Dream to your desires and claim those secrets for your own? Are you willing to go down The Rabbit Hole? Are you willing to kill for what you will find? You're about to find out...

Five Room Dungeon: The Rabbit Hole is a 5 encounter dungeon for four characters, levels 15 or greater based on the original design theory of Johnn Four of Roleplayingtip.com, which delves into the dark and surreal inner realms of the Dream and Coliseum Morpheuon. It builds on the material presented in that adventure, but does not require it.

119525.description:
Antartik is a game for two to five players aged 5 and up, who embody penguins facing each other in a diving contest. They jump from the ice shelf, in the middle of Antarctica. The penguins must perform the most impressive series of artistic figures while avoiding a disastrous belly flop, which never goes unnoticed by the well-skilled jury.

The game is made of 55 cards, numbered from 1 to 10. There is only one card marked 1, whereas there are two cards marked 2, three cards marked 3, etc., and ten cards marked 10. Some cards marked 8, 9, and 10 also feature a bonus symbol in the top left corner, representing a judge or a parachute.

Game flow
Each player takes turn trying to make up a series of figures during his dive. He can perform three kinds of actions until his turn ends:

Either drawing a card and place it in the center of the table so as to complete his series of figures. If the player draws a card which number already appears on one of the cards of the series, he keeps the last card he drew and his turn ends. The next player will choose either to keep the current series, or to return the series’ cards to the bottom of the deck.
Or stopping the current series and taking all the cards it is made of before a pair is formed. The player’s turn ends.
Or discarding a card with a "Judge" symbol to examine the top three cards in the deck and rearrange them in the order of his choice.




Before performing any of these three actions, the active player must wait for each of his opponents to:

Either raise his hand in agreement.
Or place (once per player during a series of figures) one of his cards in front of the active player’s series so as to confront him, and dare him to perform another figure. If the active player refuses the challenge or accepts it and loses, his turn ends and the player who dared him takes his card back and turns it over; now the card is worth 3 stars. If the active player accepts the challenge and succeeds, he immediately takes the card that was bet, he puts it in his stock and his turn goes on.




At any time, a player can turn over a card won during a successful challenge (i.e., a face down card) and draw the card at the bottom of the deck.

End of game
The game ends when the last card of the deck is drawn. The cards face up are worth one or two stars whereas the cards face down (from a successful bet) are worth three stars. The player with most stars wins the game and the title of "Antarctic Champion Diver".
119525.name: Antartik

119526.name: 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates (Pathfinder)
119526.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Think you've seen it all?

It's a big, scary world out there, and for your players, it's gotten nastier. 101 Not So Simple Monster Templates gives you more options, more creative flexibility and more ways to just freak out your players with new templates - itching to be added to any PFRPG monster.

Enjoy simple templates like cowardly creature who just wants to run away (even if he is a tarrasque). The Walking Fortress which makes the monster really big and puts a citadel on its back, and the Riven Magic Creature, who just wants to drain you of your spells and break your magic items.

119527.name: Barker's Circus and Sideshow
rpgissuearticle: Evocative City Sites: Barker's Circus and Sideshow
119527.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I am an explorer, a man of action, and foiler of nefarious plots. Come read my book, Evocative City Sites, and I, Owain Northway, will regale you with a tale of a cheerful yet menacing place of frivolity, a freakshow, a museum of the strange and unusual. I will tell you of Barker's Circus and Sideshow.

Evocative City Sites: a modular supplement updated to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, detailing small locations that you could find in any urban campaign setting. Each site is detailed with its own cartography, a 1”=1 square scale map pack, two unique npcs, 5 adventure seeds, a high resolution image for your virtual table top, all presented in the unique, useful, and entertaining form of Owain Northway’s first person point-of-view guidebook.

Barker's Circus and Sideshow is a place of bright lights, wonderous performances, and dark dealings behind the scenes. The ringmaster is affable yet darkly mischevious, the attractions are unsetlling (especially the freakshow), and the clowns, the less said about the clowns the better.

119528.name: Way of the Yakuza
119528.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey with us on the Way of the Yakuza!

Organizations initially created for the protection of their communities, the Yakuza have evolved into a unique culture fiercely loyal to their traditions. Easily identified by their colorful tattoos, Yakuza brethren are a hard, violent lot given to drink, gambling and lechery. They practice extortion, engage in smuggling, sell powerful narcotics, and regularly force women into prostitution. Yet, despite their numerous faults, they view themselves as folk heroes, warriors fighting for the common man against the dangers of the world.

Way of the Yakuza presents a wealth of information for players and Game Masters alike. This 36 page PDF contains an extensive overview of the Yakuza culture, Yakuza character options (including archetypes, traits, feats, spells, enchanted tattoos and more), and a new method for creating unique Yakuza-gang stat blocks. Additionally, for GM's looking for a quick adventure, there is even a Yakuza controlled mountain village, complete with map and adventure seeds. Whether you want a Yakuza centric campaign, or just want to add flavor to your setting, this book has something for you.

119529.name: Kahrvass Fleymbrow, Smith of Burning Desire
rpgissuearticle: Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Kahrvass Fleymbrow, Smith of Burning Desire
119529.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dreams made real are the only dreams that matter.

Whereas some believe that fire is a tool of destruction, the wise know that the burning heat of the forge is a source of creation as well. Stoked by the pain of an unknowable loss, the fiery genius Kahrvass Fleymbrow toils relentlessly, crafting works with an unsurpassed skill of which others can only dream.

This product provides Game Masters with details on a inspired artisan found amongst the Faces of the Tarnished Souk, ready for immediate use in any campaign - but especially for use within the Coliseum Morpheuon. Each entry features ingenious stat-blocks from multiple OGL sources, history, motivation, secrets, and insight into the NPC's most carefully guarded dreams, along with complete game statistics for low, middle, and high levels of play.

Within you will find:


Kahrvass Fleymbrow, a smoldering smith with the skills to make entire worlds.
CR 20 Male advanced magma azer artisan 17
CR 15 Male advanced magma azer artisan 13
CR 8 Male advanced azer artisan 6
Magma creature template, engineering erupting elementals that will earn your players' ire
New magical items - a brand that literally sears a character's desire into their flesh, and dreamcatchers that can intercept hazardous hopes and aggressive aspirations
And introducing the Artisan - a new class designed to create and craft with serious skill

119530.name: #30 Fleshgrafts
119530.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Come and graft both power and horror to your body!

Replace your organs and other parts with those crafted by the fleshgrafters. Take your skin and arms replace them with a trolls, Exchange your eyes for that of an anti-paladin so you can sense good, or exchange your mouth for a leech maw!

Brought you by the critically acclaimed author of #30 Intelligent Magic Items and #30 Haunts for Ships and Shore, T.H. Gulliver brings you a host of disturbing new options and horrific rewards.

Make the appointment for your procedure today!

119531.name: Dégage
119531.description: Dégage is a semi-cooperative card game that takes on the theme of the Tunisian Jasmine Revolution (or more aptly named The Revolution for Dignity by the Tunisians. The goal is for the players to successfully eliminate the Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali and his clique mafia. The game revolves around these seven Zaba members; each have a specific power related to their personality that benefits them, but not those in the general population. These are known as character "defects" in the game. These "defects" are represented by various icons on the cards and indicate what "pressue" can be used to "eliminate" the character. Once players line up enough cards with the matching icons for a character, the character is removed. The person who dethrones the seventh character is the winner. If the 7 characters are not removed before the end of the game, all players have lost.

119532.name: The Dungeon of the Rat
119532.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The village of Millet's Crossing is a small and unassuming place. There is little of interest to the wandering sword-for-hire except for a nice inn and a general store. But the Troll's Trove provides a welcome bit of rest and relaxation to your band of road-weary adventurers. Just as soon as you have settled in, however, your host offers you a rather odd business proposition. It seems that the Troll's Trove has rats in it's cellar and these rats are stealing things all over town. What is really odd is that they are leaving behind small jade rat statues. A nice reward awaits those that can clear out the infestation and put a stop to the thefts. It appears to be a simple task, but one must be careful; even rats have gods.

This book contains details for the village of Millet's Crossing and the Dungeon of the Rat which lies right beneath the calm, rural community. The Dungeon of the Rat is suited for a party of four to six first-level characters. A mix of character types is recommended including at least one wizard and one rogue.

119533.name: Énigmes absurdes
119533.description:
The goal of the game is to invent explanations to solve different puzzles and problems.

For example, if you read the riddle "Louis XIV was thrown from the roof of the castle and is not dead," you can explain that the castle was made of sand, there was a pool in the courtyard that Louis XIV fell into but it really hurts ... or that Louis XIV was actually the name of the big cat of Mary Pauline and he even landed back on its feet!

There are 4 rules for explaining:
- you create your own rules.
- You guess the explanation given by one player.
- The explanation must include a word that has nothing to do with the riddle.
- You have 1 minute to develop the story of opponent's explanation.

Every time you manage explain the enigma, you keep the card as a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most cards/points is the winner.

119534.name: Gitterrätsel! Junior
119534.description:
Gitterrätsel! Junior is the kid's version of Gitterrätsel!.

Rotating the game board reveals a sequence of images, a word or an image in an open field of the board edge is visible. Whoever first discovers the corect sequence of pictures and letters on the board is the winner. Opponents compete to discover the hidden word first corresponding to the picture and mark it with tiles. However, if another player finds a word that is marked by another opponent's tiles than that opponent looses the word. Whoever has the most at the end pieces on the game board wins! This game promotes playful speed and concentration.

119535.name: Gitterrätsel! German-English Expansion Set
boardgameexpansion: Wordquest
119535.description:
The Gitterrätsel! German-English Expansion Set is an expansion for Gitterrätsel!.

English words and their translations in German letters are hidden forward and backward, horizontally and vertically, and diagonally in a tangle of letters. The object is to find the solution to the puzzle in the grid. This game can be used to help teach children the vocabulary of a subject area and the spelling of foreign words. 20 theme cards are included in the set.

The game play of grid puzzle is also extension of the English once the same: The whole family gathered around the board and goes on a word hunt. By rotating the game board is always a word of the topic map in an open field of the visible edge of the board. The goal is to mark the found words quickly. But beware, if an opponent crosses out a pre-selected word, then is is lost to him.

This expansion set also includes a German-English puzzle grid or a new way of playing: advanced native speakers start looking for the translation of the word shown - German to English and vice versa.

119536.name: Time No Time Junior
119536.description:
Time No Time Junior is the children's version of Time No Time.

Game play: Start the timer, draw a card, perform an task (see below), pass the cards to the next player. However, the timer is random and if the task is interrupted by the alarm, then that player gets a penalty chip. The player with the most penalty chips at the end loses the game.

The Junior version of the game includes colored wooden blocks. Players just arrange these blocks in various shapes and color combinations according to the cards.

119537.name: Monopoly Movers
119537.description: A collectable version of the classic game Monopoly. This edition comes in the form of a die-cast semi-tractor trailer truck. The trailer opens to reveal a miniature version of the standard game.

119538.name: Das kleine Ich bin ich: Würfelwettlauf
119538.description:
The classic children's story Das kleine Ich bin ich tells the story of a little animal that looks similar to many other animals – yet because it's not identical to any of them, it questions its origins and place in the cosmos until it comes to the realization that "I'm not just anyone – I AM ME!"

In Das kleine Ich bin ich: Würfelwettlauf, kids relive the exciting journey of this little animal discovering itself. Turn by turn, players have up to three rolls of the dice to determine where their character moves on the path and which animals they have showing on the dice. If a player moves his token onto an animal space (frog, horse, hippo, dog) matching a rolled die and the player has not yet added all of those matching animal parts to his critter, he adds one piece jigsaw-style. The first player to complete his animal wins.

119539.name: Crypt of the Wolf Prince
119539.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ruins of a vast and ancient city that lay just a few miles outside the town of Cheapham have always been the subjects of stories and legends. But while most people in town have a story to tell, none have ever made the trek to the ruined city. A few desperate adventurers have made the journey, but none have ever returned. You have also heard the tales of great wealth to be taken from the crumbling remains of ancient temples and palaces. In particular the locals have spoken of a great warrior prince who was buried in a tomb at the edge of the city. The legend says that he was buried with a great hoard of gold. The townspeople have warned you about the price paid by those that travel to the ruins, but the reward for success is very tempting. Do you dare enter the CRYPT OF THE WOLF PRINCE?

This solitaire adventure is suitable for a single, newly created, first level character of any type with up to 20 adds. You may use any weapons, armor, or equipment you can afford. Missile weapons and magic use are also allowed. Three pregenerated characters are provided if you do not have the time or desire to create your own. Crypt of the Wolf Prince is designed for use with the Tunnels and Trolls™ game system. You will need the T&T™ rules to play this game.

119540.name: House in the Hills
119540.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You were ambushed by a group of thugs on your way through the dense woods near your home. They took everything and left you for dead. You awoke to the sound of howling wolves and have been on the run ever since. It is now after sunset and your strength is failing. The wolves are closer than they have been all day. Suddenly, just ahead you see the outline of a small building on the next hilltop. It is illuminated by the moonlight, but all of the windows are dark. As you near it, you see that the building is in a state of decay. But it may provide you shelter from the wolves until you can rest. There may even be weapons inside. Do you dare enter, the HOUSE IN THE HILLS?

This solitarie adventure is suitable for a single low-level, humanoid warrior with up to 20 personal adds. You may bring no weapons, armor, or equipment except for the clothes on your back.

House in the Hills is designed to be played using the Tunnels and Trolls™ game system. You will need the T&T™ rules to play this game.

119542.name: Seelenfänger: Grundregeln
119542.description:
user summary

This are the core rules for the german free RPG "Seelenfänger" (soulcatcher)

The complete book (pdf) includes everything that a GM and the players need to create the heroes and the first adventures.


about roleplay
the art of roleplay
the story (background of the setting)
the regions in the world
the rules, the mechanik about using skills etc.
charcter generation
combat
soul catching
magic
character specialisation (occupations, guids, skills, schools of magic, talents)
Equipment
Tips for the GM
Bestiarium
Glossar, calendar, time calculation


The RPG is licensed under the CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 germany License

119543.name: The Spellweaver
119543.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Spellweaver presents an alternate magic system that transforms arcane magic into a matter of skill and not just level climbing.

Using the new Spellweaving skill, a spellweaver is able to manipulate the threads of magic that spread throughout Existence like an infinite web of arcane energy. Using this system, arcane spells of any level may be cast so long as the character is sufficiently skilled and willing to risk the hazardous repercussions of failure.

Inside you will find instructions on how to integrate this new form of skill-based magic into your game setting, or how to replace the existing magic system outright. The simple rules for doing so are presented in easy-to-read tables that can be used for converting third party spells to Spellweaving DCs.

Also within are …


The Spellweaver Base Class, along with 4 Archetypes
4 Spellweaving-related Prestige Classes: the Battle Weaver, Cartomancer, Fated, and Weave Dancer
More than 30 new feats concerning this new magic system and notes on how existing feats relate to Spellweaving
A new race of natural spellweavers, the spider-like Ardekh
A new, Spellweaving-based goddess, a new cleric domain, new spells, and new magic items related to Spellweaving
5 new creatures, a new hazard, the Weave creature subtype, and a new creature template
More than 30 new feats concerning the Spellweaving magic system
Rules for lands where the Weave acts abnormally
All PSRD spells converted to Spellweaving DC to save you time


Updated, clarified, and expanded from the original 3.5 OGL rules release Unusual Core Classes: The Spellweaver, this latest version also adds over 30 pages of material.

The time has come to break the mold and put spell slots aside.

This product includes a coloured version and a more print friendly version with backgrounds and cover removed. Both versions are fully bookmarked and have a hyperlinked table of contents for your convenience. A spreadsheet has also been included to make calculating third-party spell DCs easier and faster.

119544.name: Seelenfänger: Ultralight
119544.description:
user summary

This are the lightrules for the german free RPG "Seelenfänger" (soulcatcher)

This is a fast rulebook to introduce Seelenfänger and contains mostly the mechanik of playing this RPG. (Quick-Start-Rules)

The RPG is licensed under the CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 germany License

119545.name: Urutsk: World of Mystery -- Autumn Vol. 1:: Players' Beta Manual
119545.description:
From publisher's description:
Urutsk: An enigmatic wetlands world strewn with treasures of the Ancients, is history lost to memory, now plays host to Human, Humanoid, and Monstrous Beings --all deadly, long-warring enemies. Urutsk is the culmination of over 25 years of setting development by Kyrinn S. Eis, author of Dawner of the First Light, and Eleventh Hour of the Soul. As much as seems familiar, there is something new around every bend: * Classic-Play (3d6 + Race + Class) from the start. Import characters from other Classic-Play games in a matter of minutes, or use the Point-Design Character Generation rules to get exactly the character you've always wanted to play. * A quick, comprehensive Combat System modelled after the action in the source material. * Detailed, yet customisable, setting. Make unique creatures and foes in just a few simple steps. Open-ended Adventuring Locations designed to jump-start the Referee's imagination.

119546.name: Urutsk: World of Mystery -- Autumn Vol. I :: Referee's Beta Manual
119546.description:
From publisher's description:
ARG's Urutsk: World of Mystery RPG now has a Referee's Manual to accompany the Players' Manual. Selected Contents- * Common Circumstances and Game Procedures * Practical advice on creating Location-based exploration and adventuring * Terrain and Hex-mapping charts * Six sample hexes detailed enough to use immediately and portable enough to use anywhere, at any time * Timeline of Historical Events, as well as a Summary of the era * Sixteen Adventure Locations designed to spark the Referee's imagination

119547.name: Vocal
119547.description: In his turn player draws a card and announce the title and artist of song. Players then bet on your success in the interpretation of the work. Finally, you push your bellowing, and each win or lose the bet.

119548.name: War Machine: The Quasi-Historical Retro-Sci Fi Role-Playing Game
119548.description:
Publisher's description:

In 1939, SS scientists managed to decipher the Stone Codex, an ancient manuscript penned by an Italian monk during the dark ages, and uncovered in 1937 from its long forgotten resting place. The codex detailed alchemical secrets and blueprints for hellish weapons of mass destruction. With the secrets of the Stone Codex, a new Empire was born...

The year is now 1942 and the world is at war. Legions of armored Axis troops occupy most of Europe, London lies under a pile of radioactive ash, and the outlook is grim.

In War Machine: The Quasi Historical Sci Fi Role-Playing Game, players take the role of fearless OSS Agents, gadget toting Scientists, tough Marine Leathernecks, and sultry Femme Fatales fighting the good fight against the overwhelming forces of the Third Reich. Do you have the guts to join the courageous few?

119549.name: Felix in the Factory
119549.description:
'Felix in the Factory' is a platform game for home computers published by Micro Power (a.k.a. Program Power). The game was first released in 1982 for the BBC Micro. It was ported to the Acorn Electron (1983), Commodore 64 (1984) and Memotech MTX (1984).

The screen layout is clearly influenced by early platform game Space Panic, set out as a series of platforms and ladders populated by enemy 'gremlins' which also bear more than a passing resemblance to the Space Panic monsters. This is the factory of the title. The player takes the role of Felix, a factory worker, whose job is to ensure the generator, in the bottom right of the screen, does not run out of oil. Felix begins at the generator and must cross the conveyor belt, jumping over parcels (in gameplay similar to Donkey Kong). If Felix fails to jump the parcel, he falls down and is carried along the belt for a short while. If he has time to stand up, he can continue on as normal but if he reaches the end of the belt, he loses a life.

After crossing the conveyor belt, Felix can climb into the rest of the factory which contains a number of randomly placed items which can be picked up and used as well as a number of enemies. The main enemies are the various gremlins that patrol the platforms. If they come into contact with Felix, they knock him off the platform and a life is lost. The other hazard is a giant rat which occasionally runs across the screen, again knocking Felix off the platform (although unlike the gremlins, it can be jumped). Felix can collect a pitchfork which lets him run at the gremlins and knock them from the platforms. This only lasts for a brief time (like the axe in Donkey Kong). There is also a bag of rat poison which can be collected and then laid down on a platform in the hope that the rat will run across that platform. Finally, Felix can collect an oil can which he must take back to the generator. If the can is dropped (by running into a wall or falling on the conveyor belt), it spills and he must return for another can. Only one item can be carried at a time.
The oil level is shown in a bar on screen and acts as a timer. As it runs down at a fast rate, the primary objective of the game is usually to collect the oil can and return it to the generator as quickly as possible. This is made especially important as if a life is lost, Felix is returned to the generator but the oil level remains as it was. If the player has spent too much time killing gremlins, this often makes it impossible for Felix to go back for the oil in time. There is a warning 'flicker' as the oil reaches a low level but unless Felix is already on the conveyor belt with a can of oil, it will be too late. If the generator runs out of oil, it is game over. If Felix successfully tops up the generator with oil, the gremlins regenerate (and sometimes increase in number) and play begins again.

Source: Wikipedia, "Felix in the Factory", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119550.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Accursed Dead is the third Battle Pack in "The Bloodquest Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game! Undead and the forces of Destruction gain unprecedented necromantic prowess. Even the forces of Order claim new control over their fallen with cards that manipulate players' discard piles and the units therein. Additionally, three of the Old World's races set off on bold new quests to disrupt their opponents' plans, the Dark Elves conduct bold raids, the Orcs gain early card draw, and an adventurous legend lends his strength to the Empire's cause.

The Accursed Dead introduces new units, tactics, and attachments (including a powerful new Artefact) that increase the value of your Heroes, legends, and quests. Face the full fury of Dark Magic in the realm of the Undead in The Accursed Dead!
119550.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Accursed Dead
boardgameexpansion: Warhammer: Invasion

119551.name: Death Rider
119551.description:
"Forget about winning, it´s just survival that counts. Big cars, even bigger guns and loads of cash along the way!"

Source: The Developer Website.

119552.name: Wisher, Theurgist, Fatalist & Weaver of Their Fates
rpg: Wisher, Theurgist, Fatalist & Weaver of Their Fates
119552.description:
From the introduction:
Reality is an illusion.
Those who seek to understand it corrode their understanding of it. In naïveté,
objects are solid, ideas are true or false, sensations are real, and
communication conveys information. To the adept, these things are as fading
dreams.
There is no object that is not also emptiness.
There is no arbiter of truth.
Sensations are the lies of Maya; they are the shifting of electrical patterns in
the brain; they are signifiers without referent.
Communication is violence.
Reality is false.
It does not matter how many layers one peels back. It does not matter what
revelations one has. This is because there is no truth.
We are things that we have dreamed, and there is no sense in it, and when the
sleeper wakes we shall be washed away.

119553.name: Kimpassa
119553.description:
A game for couples to find out what irritates them in their partners and what they really love about them. The game board is divided into to two parts, the first part of the board is about the things you hate and as you go on, you'll get to the side of the board that's about the things you love about your partner.

The game includes three different categories. The annoying things in your partner, the really irritating things in your partner and the things you love in your partner. In the first three categories, the pair draws three cards and then both of them arrange the cards in order of most annoying or most lovable by writing them up on paper. The pairs take turns on whose point of view the cards are arranged. If they get the most annoying/lovable thing right, they'll move 2 steps, if they'll get all right, they'll move 3 steps.

Also included is "What would you do category?" that challenges the partners to think how they or their partner would act in different specific situations, for example, how would you act if your mother-in-law would pay you a visit?

The pair that crosses the finish line first wins!

119554.name: Visions (Issue 00 - 1999)
119554.description:
User Summary

Sample issue of Vision Magazine produced prior to main releasse

Contents

•Newsdesk - The latest on major developments in the RPG scene - who's releasing what and when - who's starting up and why
•Fistful of Dwarfs- Phil Masters. co-author of GURPS discworld, reveals a little-known place in the back of beyond
•News Decks - More power to your card hand with a look at the new rules for MtG, Classic edition plus Aliens and Star Trek expansion decks
•Small Worlds - Taking a look at the Alternative Armies pre-painted Smartpak figures for Table-top RPGs or for large scale fantasy Wargames

119555.name: Zombie Hunting
119555.description:
User Summary

Zombie Hunting is an arcade shooter game. You will have to face hordes of zombies and introduce them to your powerful cannon, to deal with them you have got 4 different kind of ammo. When you kill a zombie you can collect money to buy more advance weapons and also you can capture zombies to get more money. The game has cartoonish graphics.

119556.name: Ship of the Line
119556.description:
From the cassette inlay

You are an officer in the Royal Navy of the 17th century, in command of a Ship of the Line in the Mediterranean. The object of the game is to battle with other ships in order to win the favor of your superiors. However, you must ensure that you have adequate supplies of food, water and ammunition and that you have enough crew members to man the ship, otherwise you may be forced to surrender mid battle of set upon by a hungry crew!

119557.description:
Your goal is to be the first to have set up your herd of 10 cows, calves and bulls of the same color.
But beware! Your opponents are ruthless and will not hesitate to send you the worst nasties like drought, mad cow etc.

In his turn player play a card for his herd or nasty card for his opponent.

Player who set up his herd first avoiding the nasty cards is the winner.
119557.name: Cheptel
boardgameexpansion: Cheptel L'Extension

119558.name: Tiny Defense
119558.description:
"Green Planet is the beautiful home of the little mechanical life forms known as Minirobots. While living peacefully, their planet was invaded by an army of ruthless robot troops calling themselves The Machines. These machines want to turn Green Planet into a space resort and have captured many of the Minirobots, but now they are fighting back!

Use your wit and tactics to overcome the obstacles and save the gorgeous Green Planet! Collect energy crystal to build your army of robot and fight to rescue your friends. Beware! The enemies are everywhere; on the ground, in the sky, over the sea and even under there!

Tiny Defense features bright cartoony graphics with funny characters, easy-to-learn gameplay with a good depth to please strategy fans, a vast number of levels and mini-games with challenging boss fight.

Stand united and prove that size doesn't matter in Tiny Defense, a playful challenge for strategy game lovers!"

Source: The Game Website.

119559.name: Cheptel L'Extension
boardgameexpansion: Cheptel
119559.description:
Expansion for Cheptel.
Add 36 card to the base game: Additional color of cows and plenty of new dirty tricks to tempt Your opponents.

119560.name: Maidenheim Book I: Amazon Adventures
119560.description:
From Introduction:

Amazon Adventures is divided into two sections, the first of which will help you gain an understanding of just who the Amazons were, what they likely believed in about themselves, men, and especially non-Amazonian women, and their relations with the encroaching world around them. It is not supposed to be a historical, mythological, or scholarly work on the Amazons or Greek Mythology, nor does it assume to surpass, challenge, or replace anyone else's perceptions on just who the Amazons were and what they represented. This material is also left generic enough so that it can apply to any d20 campaign setting.

The second section is specific material for the Maidenheim: The Age of Scorn Amazon Campaign Setting, such as the races available for use as player characters, goddesses and deities for priestesses, and modified styles of armor for Amazon warriors in this particular campaign.

119561.name: Humpty Dumpty in the Garden
119561.description:
From the cassestte inlay:

Humpty Dumpty is having all kinds of problems. He has to water the flowers in his garden, but whilst he does, the weeds keep growing! Can you help Humpty Dumpty to keep his garden free of weeds?

By turning certain taps on and blocking holes you can direct the water from the sprinkler onto the flowers and not onto the weeds.
It is not as easy as it sounds and you had better be careful not to get swamped in a jungle of weeds.

119562.name: Seelenfänger: Die Andere Seite
119562.description:
user summary

This is the first adventure book for the german free RPG "Seelenfänger" (soulcatcher)

It contains 3 adventures:


Nebelfahrt
Hexen, Hexen, Hexen, Hexen
Ein Wintermärchen


The RPG is licensed under the CC-BY-NC-ND 3.0 germany License

119563.name: Maidenheim Book III: Nations and Empires
119563.description:
From Introduction:

You hold in your hands a detailed guide to the nations and empires that make up the core lands of Maidenheim. Within each chapter you will be introduced to one of the cultures and civilizations of the world of Scythae. You will learn their histories and pasts, the lay of the lands and the geographies, the ways of their people, their enemies and allies, the fate of Man within their borders, and the role in which these nations, often referred to as queendoms play in the modern world.

119564.name: Blood Waters
119564.description:
From publisher blurb:

This underwater adventure for four to six 7th-level PCs explores treachery and regicide beneath the surface of the Razor Sea. The Coral Kingdom ruled by their locathah king is surrounded by a demonic kraken’s ravening hordes. But the greatest threat to Sea King’s Court lies within.

119565.name: Death Beneath the Waves
119565.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is no greater frontier of mystery and danger than the crushing black depths of the unforgiving sea. Underwater adventures send heroes into a hostile realm where ichthyoidal alien things prowl the cold currents, and the environs themselves choke off life. Running a game beneath the waves isn’t easy. Thankfully one of the world’s best fantasy game designers offers six pages of pdf packed with a plethora of tips, tricks, rules, and a brand new beastie to pump air into the gills of any GM brave enough to delve the watery deeps.

119566.name: Feats Volume I
119566.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is a collection of feats culled from the Races of Evernor series, including feats from the soon-to-be released Races of Evernor, Part III. In addition to these, several brand-new feats were added for flavor and variety.

Since many of the feats were originally designed specifically for the races found in Races of Evernor, Parts I-III, this collection of feats has been re-edited so that the unique abilities of those races can be more accessible to almost any character. Most can now be used by almost in race in virtually any campaign! That said, a few feats are still better suited for unusual PCs or world settings (monstrous PCs, aquatic campaigns, etc.).

Feats Volume I contains nearly 90 feats and is the perfect product for DMs and players who want a wider variety of special abilities for their campaigns or characters. It is also a boon for those not necessarily interested in new PC races that want access to many of the feats in the RoE series of supplements.

119567.name: Five Free Races
119567.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file contains five free races released to support the Realms of Evernor setting. These races feature the same detail, description and game statistics as the races in our other Races of Evernor products.

Indluded in this collection are:

Mallean - a race of durable humanoids with pliable bones. (Bonus race for Races of Evernor Part I)
Zweibold - a Medium size race of two-headed kobold-kin. (Bonus race for Races of Evernor Part I)
Krohlvar - A savage race of humanoids from the wilderness of a distant, uncharted continent. (Bonus race for Races of Evernor Part II)
Frenaqi - A gentle race of four-armed humanoids. They are the backbone of manual labor in many cities around Evernor. (Bonus race for Races of Evernor Part II)
Dalnoy - This reclusive, artistic race of giant spiders lives in peace and harmony with fey and other sylvan races. (The first bonus race for the upcoming Races of Evernor III)




Download them and use them in the Realms of Evernor or your own campaign world today!

119568.name: Attack of the Saucerman
119568.description:
User Summary

Attack of the Saucerman is a comedic science fiction 3D action game. You play as Ed, a blue-collar worker from the alien world of Grimloid. There are 28 arcade-like levels with a variety of weapons.

119569.name: Ruins & Ronin
119569.description:
From the PDF:

In RUINS & RONIN, the players take on the roles of bujin (fighting-men, including samurai), spell-casting shugenja, and wise sohei (warrior monks). Will they choose to explore strange ruins in the wilderness? Deep, forgotten dungeons under crumbling pagoda-fortresses built by ancient sorcerers? Perhaps if they achieve great status and power, they might even become daimyos, lords of castles with private armies and fearsome reputations. But the wild places of this world contain strange and fearsome monsters as well as vast riches and magical items. Spirit creatures roam the wilderness by night, and the rocky hills abound with goblins and their kin, always looking to the civilized lands below as a source of plunder and conquest. This is the legend-world of RUINS & RONIN. Samurai up.

119570.name: Battle Shots
119570.description: The Drinking game version of Battleship! Secretly arrange your BattleShots™ ships on your shot board, placing them either horizontally or vertically. Each ship is composed of a designated number of shot glasses placed in a row. You should have three shot glasses for the battleship, two shot glasses for the destroyers, and one shot glass for your submarine.

119571.name: No Fear Downhill Mountain Bike Racing
119571.description:
No Fear Downhill Mountain Biking is a mountain bike video game released in 1999 on PlayStation. The game was developed and published by Codemasters.

An extreme sports game, the mountain bike consists of mountain tracks from circuits around the world of varying difficulty. The game was inspired by tracks including San Francisco's Telegraph Hill and New Zealand's Matukituki Rapids.

The game has eight different riders and a number of tracks for the bikes to descend.

Source: Wikipedia, "No Fear Downhill Mountain Biking", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119572.name: Marine Sharpshooter II: Jungle Warfare
119572.description:
From the back of the box:

You are an elite military sniper.

Deployed in one of Africa's most dangerous countries, your mission is to find the President of Burundi and rescue him from heavily armed rebels and the ruthless mercenaries who back them. If the rebels are not stopped and the President dies, they will plunge the region into a brutal civil war. Use your elite military training and advanced weaponry to fight against the odds and restore Democracy!

119573.name: Marine Sharpshooter 3
119573.description:
From the back of the box:

You are an elite Sniper/Spotter team deployed to infiltrate, investigate and eliminate the dark plots that exist in Iran's terrorist underground. Use stealth, precision strikes and deadly accuracy to cut out key targets in the ongoing fight against terrorism and international security.

119575.name: Nightfall Mysteries: Black Heart
119575.description:
Stop the evil Vansig family before they point their vengeful wrath at your friend Christine in Nightfall Mysteries: Black Heart! Just as Viggo and Christine believed themselves free from the shackles of the Vansig family, an enemy they thought dead returns to kidnap Viggo, destroying the newfound peace of the lovers. Powerless to save Viggo by herself, Christine has called upon your help in Nightfall Mysteries: Black Heart!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119576.name: Nightfall Mysteries: Asylum Conspiracy
119576.description:
Help Christine explore the spooky Ashburg Asylum and find her missing grandfather in this dark Hidden Object game! Travel to the eerie grounds of Ashburg and work your way through spine-chilling locations. Solve unique puzzles to progress deeper into the asylum, and closer to Christine’s grandfather. Meet interesting characters, unravel a mystery, and uncover an evil plot in Nightfall Mysteries: Asylum Conspiracy!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119577.name: Nightfall Mysteries: Curse of the Opera
119577.description:
Take on the role of a lowly stagehand in an opera company tasked with solving a deadly mystery! The Opera troupe is invited by the reclusive Count Vladd Vansig III to his small hamlet to perform a special Opera for him. Strangely, there are no villagers to speak of except for the Count and his caretaker. Over the course of the night, people go missing and are killed! Use your Hidden Object skills to find out the identity of the killer and escape the village alive in Nightfall Mysteries – Curse of the Opera!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119578.description:
Spodd is a two player game with a twist for the Shibumi game system.

Equipment: the 4x4 Shibumi board, balls in two colors. The board is rotated 45 degrees to have clearly seven columns with varying number of balls (1-3-5-7-5-3-1 on the surface of the Shibumi pyramid).

Rules: the board starts with two red balls placed in the left and right corner holes. Two players, White and Black, take turns placing one ball of each color adjacent to each other. The balls can be placed on board holes or on top of 2x2 platforms of existing balls. You can place a ball on a hole and the other on a platform, as long as they touch each other.

Aim: without the left and right corner holes there are five columns with an odd number of balls on the pyramid surface (3-5-7-5-3). When the pyramid is complete, the player with the most visible balls in a column wins that column. The winner is the player who has won at least 3 columns.

Variant for expert players: players score one point when they have conquered a column composed by three balls, two points for a five balls column and three points for the seven balls column. The winner is the player with the highest score.

Note: the game has an odd number of columns composed by an odd number of balls. Ties are not possible.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf
119578.name: Spodd

119579.name: grAtitude!
119579.description:
The "It's all about grAtitude!" project began with an idea several years ago to teach, in a fun and entertaining way, age-old universal principles of prosperity and abundance that have been taught in every major spiritual and cultural tradition. Those principles are known today by names such as Law of Attraction, Law of Allowing, Law of Gratitude, etc.

The idea, conceived by Theuns Serfontein in South Africa, was to use a board and card game (played much like a cross between Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit) to teach and promote these principles. In 2010 the Law of Attraction worked to put Theuns together with Steve Vernon (a graphic and web designer in the United States) through an online marketing company in which they both were involved and, thanks to Skype, they became not only business partners, but very close friends. A few months later, Theuns asked Steve to partner with him in his dream of creating "grAtitude!"- the game (originally called "Bridge to Success").

The grAtitude! board game is played by tossing dice, moving around the "G"-shaped track, drawing cards from any of the four decks (depending on what space you land on), and following the instructions on the card within a certain time frame. You may, for example, have 30 seconds to name as many things as possible that start with the letter "D" that you're grateful for and win 1000 grati for each thing you name, or you might be told the Universe just rewarded you with 5,000 grati because you wrote down three daily goals this morning, or you might be asked to complete a famous quote or answer a multiple choice question. With over 700 cards in the game, the possibilities are almost endless!

119580.name: Sjørøver-skatten
119580.description:
vintage roll dice and move game from 1941;
Players start at the coast of South America and "sails" west.
The target is being the first to Sail to the Tonga Isles in one piece and find the great Pirate treasure, all the while avoiding bad weather, pirates, coral reefs and other dangers along the way.

There is only one rather swirly route that takes you across the pacific oceans over towards Australia and The target Tonga Isles (passing Islands and groups like Tahiti, Baker Island, Gilbert Isle, St Cruz & Fidji) and if you hit certain spots/numbers along the travel, actions are taken according to rulesheet.

119582.name: AFL Challenge
119582.description:
AFL Challenge is a sports game for the PlayStation Portable, based on the AFL. The game was developed by Australian games developer Wicked Witch Software, and was published by Tru Blu Entertainment and Sony Computer Entertainment. The games fixture is based on the 2009 AFL season and features all official AFL teams and players.

Source: Wikipedia, "AFL Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119584.name: Pathways (Issue 12 - Feb 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Sacred Sepulchers: Preists of Death, Murder and the Undead
Top Ten Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible products for 2011
Twenty Questions withh Owen K.C. Stephens
119584.description:
From the publisher's website

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Game Content for you to take to the table. You'll find articles by Jonathan McNulty (Curse of the Golden Spear Trilogy), T. H. Gulliver (#30 Haunts for Objects), Creighton Broadhurst (Caves & Caverns),and Ron Lundeen (Pathfinder Society Scenario #3-05: Tide of Twilight) . Also you will find a retrospective look at the best third party products of 2011 by Endzeitgeist and Dark Mistress!

119585.name: After Burner: Black Falcon
119585.description:
After Burner: Black Falcon is a flight combat simulation video game. Unlike previous games in the series, it is exclusive to the PlayStation Portable and not a port of an arcade game.

Source: Wikipedia, "After Burner: Black Falcon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119586.name: GURPS Combat Cards
119586.description:
From the intro:

The Easy Way to Assess Your Choices

Combat is the most chaotic situation in any roleplaying game. So many targets, so many opportunities . . . so many options. Half the trick in figuring out the thing you should do is remembering all the things you can do.
And that’s where GURPS Combat Cards come in. These free gaming aids list all your possible GURPS Fourth Edition combat options in any situation. Just print ‘em out, cut ‘em out, and keep ‘em handy for your next gaming session.

119587.name: GURPS Skill Categories
119587.description:
From the intro:

The alphabetical skill list in the GURPS Basic Set, Fourth Edition is ideal for looking up specific skills by name . . . but not so handy when you’re trying to create a character or a template, and want to select a small handful of suitable skills from among the hundreds of options in the Basic Set. This document sorts skills into categories that coincide with likely career paths for adventurers.

119589.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 11 - Oct 1999)
119589.description: This issue contains the 3rd part of the Article "Magie des Stabes", the adventure "Entscheidung in den Bergen" An article how to play Midgard adventures in DSA and the scenario "Willkommen in Freidland"

119590.name: Nit de Reis
119590.description:
Nit de Reis is a free web-published game offered by the radio station Catalunya Ràdio for the Epiphany feast of 2012 (the traditional day in Catalonia for giving Christmas presents to children, tha day of the three Magi).

It is a push-your-luck game with just six dice. In the dice there are three kinds of presents (low-valued, mid-valued and high-valued), the Magi and coal (the typical present that the Magi give to naught children). Each player can roll the dice up to five times and after each roll he can keep as many dice as he wants. You only get points for just one kind of present and only if the Magi are present. But beware! The first time coal appears, you lose one die, and the second time, you lose everything! So it's wise not to be too greedy! The three Magi don't like greedy children!

119591.description:
In the card-driven board game Rialto, the goal is to earn the most victory points (VPs), which are awarded for a variety of things. The game board displays the six districts of Venice, and players earn VPs for placing council members into these, for building bridges and placing gondolas to connect the districts with one another, and for building advantageous buildings.

The game is played over six rounds, with each round consisting of three phases:

1. Acquire cards: Each player takes a set of cards.
2. Play cards: Players use cards to perform certain actions.
3. Activate buildings: Players may take advantage of their buildings and use their powers.

In phase 1, sets of eight cards are displayed (with six cards face-up and two face-down). Each player takes one set, then reduces his hand to seven cards. A card shows one of six specific characters (Architect, Merchant, etc.) or is a wild card.

Phase 2 consists of six sub-phases in a fixed order, one for each character. In each sub-phase, players choose whether or not to play one or more cards of that specific character. Each card allows them to perfom that character's action, for example:


Take one piece of gold for each Merchant card you play.
Place one council member into the current district for each Council card you play.
Take a building with a value equal to or lower than the number of Architect cards played. The higher its value, the better its function.


Whoever plays the most cards in each such sub-phase receives a bonus of one free action of that type. In case of a tie, whoever is farthest along the "Doge" bar gets the bonus – and of course to advance on the Doge bar, players need to play Doge cards.

Finally, in phase 3, players may take advantage of their buildings. For each piece of gold paid, a player may use one of his building's ability.

Players collect VPs both during the game – from special buildings and by building bridges between districts – and at the end of it – for majorities of council members in each district. The value of each district evolves during the game: Each district is adjacent to four other ones, and at the end of the game, they will be connected either via bridges or gondolas. A bridge increases the value of the adjacent districts by 3-6 victory points, whereas a gondola increases this value by 1 point. The player with the most council members in a district earns VPs equal to the district's total value, the player with the secondmost council members earns half this value, and so on. While it's important to establish majorities in the districts, it's also crucial to control their values by cleverly placing those bridges and gondolas.
119591.name: Rialto
boardgamepodcastepisode: DdJ 018. Zona Lúdica. Asylum Games. Peká Editorial. Ludonova. Gonzo Bríos.
Exploring Games, Episode 19: Exploring a Feld Showdown (Bruges vs. Rialto)!
Garrett's Games 362 - Augustus, Rialto, and SdJ
Garrett's Games 364 - Romans Go Home, Rialto, and Second Copies
Garrett's Games 474 - Bora Bora, Bruges, and Rialto
SpieLamaCast
TDT - Episode # 323 - Epic Games
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!

119595.name: Hollywood Monsters
119595.description:
Hollywood Monsters is an adventure game by the Spanish developer Pendulo Studios which was released in 1997. The game received an indirect sequel in 2011 known in Spain as Hollywood Monsters 2 and internationally as The Next BIG Thing.

Two journalists, Sue Bergman and Ron Ashman, are the protagonists of the game. The two work for a Los Angeles newspaper called The Quill but dislike each other and are bitter rivals. In the introductory scene we see the Quill editor telling Ron about a "Monsters' Ball"—a social event where all the Hollywood movie monsters have a big party at the mansion of Otto Hanover, a film producer. The editor stresses that The Quill must cover the event because it is too important to miss. Ron is not enthusiastic, but when Sue comes in Ron tells the editor how important it is that The Quill sends its best reporter and that he is the only one capable of accomplishing the task. This has the expected effect: Sue proclaims that she is the best journalist The Quill has and that there is no way Ron could do a decent job. Sue then proceeds to the Hanover mansion in her little sports car.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hollywood Monsters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119596.name: Shinobi II: The Silent Fury
119596.description:
The G.G. Shinobi II: The Silent Fury (ザ・GG 忍 II) is a side-scrolling action game by Sega released for the Game Gear in 1992. It is the sequel to The G.G. Shinobi, an off-shoot of the Shinobi series created for Sega's portable platform. The player controls Joe Musashi as he rendezvous with his ninja allies from the previous game, giving the player access to different characters with unique abilities as the game progresses.

Joe Musashi has to rescue the four fellow ninja and retrieve their corresponding Elemental Crystals, before the final showdown against the evil Black Ninja in his castle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shinobi II: The Silent Fury", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119597.name: Kobold Quarterly (Issue 20 - Winter 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Bardic Charisma Meets Crunch and Chickens
The Power of the Game Master
119597.description:
Table of contents:

4 Hitting the Target
8 The Elven Archer
14 Arrows of the Arbonesse
16 Derro Ooze Magic
26 Servants from Beyond
34 Night Terrors
38 The Power of the Game Master
40 Captured in the Cartways
46 Putting the Band Back Together
48 Fey Hunters & Shadow Hounds
52 AGE of Specialization
