If You Buy One Game - The Farming Edition
Low Player Count - Ep. 4 - Getting Ready for 'Sommer' Vacation
Podcast EP03 – Ameritrash
The One About Beer
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 73

119891.name: Dokapon: Monster Hunter
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
119891.description:
Dokapon: Monster Hunter, known in Japan as Dokapon Q: Monster Hunter (ドカポンQ モンスターハンター?) and known in Europe as Dokapon: Monster Hunter! is a 2001 role-playing video game video game developed and published by Asmik Ace Entertainment for the Game Boy Advance in Japan on August 3, 2001. It was later published in North America by AIA on November 30, 2001, and in Europe by Ubisoft on June 21, 2002.

Dokapon takes place on Dokkano Island, in the town of Poponga. The goal of the game is to become a licensed adventurer - to do this, the player must pass an adventurer's exam by completing a number of assigned missions, which requires the player to defeat many monsters in battle. Once weakened, the player can collect the monster and use it in future battles to defeat opponents, as with other games such as Pokemon.

The goal of the game is to complete tasks that are given to the player. Dungeons are randomly generated each time the player enters them. Staircases allow the player to move between floors in the dungeons. Within the dungeons are scattered items, weapons, and shields which may be used or sold once the dungeon is completed. Aside from the treasures are monsters. Some will chase you, some will wander freely, some run from you.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dokapon: Monster Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119892.description:
"Join the Earth Heroes on a quest to save the planet!"

It is time for kids to take charge and rescue Earth, which has been ruined by adults. The players are time travelling heroes who must make their way back to Earth from 2259AD and save it from destruction.

The game includes a Team Play option where co-operation is essential, instead of playing as individuals. Game play consists of moving by die roll and following the instructions on the square reached: this could be answering a question from a card, taking a chance card or doing an action card.

There is no waste in the game - the box becomes the board, all the components are made from recycled materials and there is no plastic.

Produced by a team of high school students as part of Young Enterprise.
119892.name: Mission Earth

119893.name: Calculus
119893.description:
Playing with four mathematical operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, thanks to two dice.
If the dice show a 6 and a 3, you choose 3 or 6 or 6-3 6x3 or 6:3

In his turn player rolls the dice and choose one of the ADDITION, SUBTRACTION, MULTIPLICATION or DIVISION to gradually bring all his chips from the start square to finish square.

119894.name: Vorsicht! Schwarzes Loch!
119894.description:
Objective: be the first escaping from the dark castle
- moving/acting by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
roll the die - 1d6, 1 coloured die, event cards - encounter a ghost, stop at traffic lights, try to find a shortcut, block your opponents...

remarks:
game was developed for >Industrie Und Kunst< by 'Ilse Spiel'

119895.name: Haegemonia: The Solon Heritage
119895.description:
With Haegemonia : The Solon Heritage, discover the official expansion of haegemonia Legions of Iron. With fantastic new innovations, and graphics that are even more stunning graphics, your haegemonia experience just went into light speed!

Main features
15 new maps in solo and multiplayer modes.
10 new ships (including diplomatics ships, race-specific ships, probes).
Simultaneous Invention Research.
New spy missions (abilities).
New special effects created by the unique Walker engine.
New units (heroes, mercenaries) specifically created for diverse tactics.
Rebalanced gameplay for inventions and ships - only works for the addon.

Source: The Developer Website.

119896.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2012
119896.description:
Pro Evolution Soccer makes its return this fall, Pro Evolution Soccer 2012! This year, Konami is determined to give global football fans a truly realistic, immersive and a delightfully playable take on the beautiful game. Creative Producer Shingo "Seabass" Takatsuka has been sourcing the desires of fans across the globe and working non-stop on marrying the digital game to the real life game so fans can get as close to the real thing. All elements have been examined - defense, offense, AI, penalties, officiating and of course, graphics! The result is a game truly represents the key attributes of the game and it's players. Pro Evolution Soccer… "Can you play?"

Features:
• Teammate AI has become more true to life on defense and offense - Your team plays more cohesively
• New Off-the-ball-controls - Take even more control in dead-ball situations to manage your team strategy
• Zonal marking and positional defending are massively enhanced - Players are forced to work harder to split defenders
• Collision detection is overhauled - The physicality of top-level soccer is captured
• Graphics are updated again -Movements, facial representations and pitches have built upon last year's massive improvements

Source: The Game Website.

119897.description: UK map of TTR. Available in a few variants, see links for details.
119897.name: UK (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)
boardgameexpansion: UK Cynical Edition (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Ticket to Ride
Ticket to Ride: Europe
Ticket to Ride: Märklin
Zug um Zug: Deutschland

119898.name: Food Fight iOS
119898.description:
Food Fight iOS is a card game in which the players recruit fighting entrees and side dishes to build a meal to battle it out in a food fight. Cards such as Private Pancake and Mean Burrito can be used to build you army. You can even use condiments to fortify your army. The game features the card draft mechanic from the original game. It has a Campaign mode, versus mode with AI players, offline multiplayer, and online multiplayer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119899.description:
As the leader of your country's federal police, you must stop the infamous Merchant of Death and his international team of Gunrunners as he sells his weapons of destruction in war-torn and drug-ridden countries Will your agents succeed and bring the Merchant of Death to justice?

The object of Gunrunners is to confiscate more crates of weapons than your opponents. Players take turns deploying their agents into one of four locations (Central America, Middle East, North Africa, Southeast Asia). During the game, crates of weapons are delivered to the different locations, so some locations will have more weapons than others. At the end of the game, players confiscate weapons from each of the locations based upon how many agents they deployed to that location. In addition, players may use "Special Operatives" to give them special powers that alter the game play in interesting ways.
119899.name: Gunrunners
boardgameexpansion: Gunrunners: Homens de Preto

119900.name: Battle B-Daman
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
119900.description:
Yamato Delgado dreams of playing B-Daman, the ancient sport of the B-DaWorld--and his dream comes true when he is chosen to wield Cobalt Blade, the most powerful B-Daman ever. Yamato must use Cobalt Blade to compete in B-Daman tournaments and defeat the evil B-Daplayers of the Shadow Alliance, who will not stop at nothing to take over the B-DaWorld. Yamato will also meet characters both familiar and unknown on his journeys, including the warm-hearted Alan and the sinister-looking Goblin. Only a few have what it takes to become a B-Daplayer; will Yamato become the B-Dachampion?

Source: The Publisher Website.

119901.name: Noddy: A Day in Toyland
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
119901.description:
Spend A Day in Toyland with Noddy and the rest of the gang from Make Way for Noddy! Wake up with a smile and spend the day spreading warmth and cheer to friends who need help. Meet favorite characters including Big Ears, Martha Monkey, Mr. Wobbly Man, and more. Help Mr. Sparks find his Tools, track down Tessie Bear's dog, and more on 12 different levels. The world of Toyland comes to life with familiar 3D animations and sounds as kids learn life lessons and values and an entertaining way. Kids can even make a Noddy photo album with real pictures from the show.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119904.name: Pinball Jam
119904.description:
User Summary

A traditional pinball game plagued with some issues on the system such as a playing field that didn't fit on the screen all at once.

119906.description:
Overview

Don’t Push Your Luck is an educational game, designed to incite discussion between the players about hemophilia, as well as help youth that live with the condition learn how to make decisions that are in their best interests. The game supports 2-4 players and is played over the course of 45 minutes. The game contains mechanisms that are not normally seen in educational games, and the effect is learning through engagement (fun). It also features attractive youth-friendly graphic design to further increase the accessibility, engagement and desire to play. Don't Push Your Luck combines light strategy of a family Euro with the fun and social exploration of a Party Game.

Just Another Day
Each player in Don’t Push Your Luck takes on the role of a child with hemophilia competing to have the most well balanced lifestyle, while trying to manage the risk they take in their activities. Players will be faced with the constant challenge of balancing of risk vs reward. The game is played over three rounds, each representing one full day.

There is a central board surrounded by 16 activity cards, that are randomly drawn before the beginning of each round. Each activity card represents a specific type of health: mental, social, emotional, and physical. In turn, players go around the board picking up activity cards and placing them in their player area. This represent them performing this activity. For example: on your turn you may choose to take the “hockey” activity card. Hockey provides 2 physical icons on it. These icons are later used to obtain “stars”, at the various “star spaces” around the board. The player with the most “stars” at the end of the game is declared the winner.

Inciting Discussion
Players must be mindful of the activities they choose to participate in during the day, because at the end of every round (3 total), each player tells a story about their day by describing each of the activities they selected. When the storyteller is finished telling describing each of their selected activities, the other players have an opportunity to discuss which of those activities they felt were not in the best interest of the story teller. The storyteller will often be trying to play down the risk of their selected activities, as they will be judged by the other players.
119906.name: Don't Push Your Luck!
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

119907.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 4 - 2005)
119907.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 4)

Contents:

Features
Soul Survivor - Original Fan Fiction By Conrad Clark aka Chaos Nomad
Absolution - Original Fan Fiction By Sean Poindexter aka The God Brain
Character Development - Knight Lords
Tome of the Guardians - The Sword from the Stone
Children of the Night - Count Yvern the Scourge
Love, Labour and Lynch Mobs - Demihumans in Ravenloft
Growls in the Night - Dread Wyrms
Feudalism in the Dread Realms - Medieval society in Ravenloft By Dmitri Zorin
Corners of the Core - The Black Spire
Perilous Pursuits - The Accursed
Whispers of Darkness - Magic of the Grave
Tactics and Techniques - Blessings of Hala
Death Flies on Swift Wings - Dread Vargouille and the Flying Skull By Morten Olsen
Castle Falkenstein - A Ravenloft Adventure Edited by Dimitri Zorin and Chaos_Nomad
From the Lab - Falkovnian Super Soldiers

Masque of the Red Death
Secrets and Sorcery - The Warden Foundation
Tools of War - Ammunition in the War on Evil

Credits
Contributors
Editors

119908.name: Europas Bilveier
119908.description:
A typical roll and move game with a theme of travelling by car through western Europe. Each player draws destination cards and have to travel from Berlin to them and back to Berlin the fastest. There are naturally some special fields along the way; bordercontrols, gas stations and accidents.

This version is Norwegian, with no known publisher, but with production nr 2201 and according to the map and general production has to date from the between the first and second world war. There are references to East Prussia and Jugoslavia on the map as well as country borders that are different than today's.

As game production in Norway was very limited during this period, and the fact that Berlin is the starting and ending point as well as all the countries and cities are named in their national language, one may assume that the game is a localized version of a foreign game.

119909.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 5 - 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Not Just an Ordinary Trip to Muhar
Shoals on the Sea of Sand
119909.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 5)

Contents:

Features
The Reapers of Ashkazeer - Original Fan Fiction By Conrad Clark
Face Value - Original Fan Fiction By Jared Jenkins
Not Just an Ordinary Trip to Muhar - Original Fan Fiction By Tami Sammons
In the Ruins of Eternity - Spiritual Beliefs of the Akiri
Shoals on the Sea of Sand - Natural Hazards in the Amber Wastes
Wrath of the Ancients - Curses from the Amber Waste
Aljaugasba - City of Temptation
Character Development - Archaeologist
Sephren's Pyramid - Grave of the Pharaoh By Dmitri Zorin
Fitful Slumber - The Secret Life of the Ancient Dead
Corners of the Core - Deir el Medina
Children of the Night - Inanamen
Growls in the Night - The Serpent Folk
Tome of the Guardians - The Spear of Ahmoth By Joseph Zettelmaier aka Bela
The Cult of Khepri - An Akiri Cult in the Core By Joseph Zettelmaier
Character Development - Grave Robber

Masque of the Red Death
Secrets and Sorcery - The Order of the Cobra
Prince of the Nile - The Mummy of Tutankamen
The Rising Dark - An Alternate Setting for Masque of the Red Death

Credits
Contributors
Editors

119910.name: Death School
119910.description:
From the publisher's website:

"It's the CIA's most elite school for covert agents. America's deadliest enemies are coming with a final exam."

Death School is an over-the-top eighties-action-movie-themed Lady Blackbird hack. Bring a flag; you will be waving it. Be advised: This game is ludicrously offensive in all the ways jingoistic eighties films were.

119919.name: Abkürzung
119919.description:
This game is a merchandising product of the formerly "Dresdner Bank".

Goal of the game is collecting shares, while reducing your cash to 5.000 "Drumbo"´s.

Each player gets an amount of 30.000 (3 or 4 players) or 50.000 (2 players) Drumbos.

The players move forward or backwards on the board and may draw different cards, accordingly the field they end their move. The players need to stop on the field "Bankfiliale" to change cash into shares.

End-Scoring:
In the order of arrival at the goal, the players multiply their shares with 4 (first player), 3 (second player), 2 (third player). The player with the highest amount of shares wins.

119920.name: 4. Buch: Das Buch der Spielwelt
119920.description:
user summary

4. Buch - Das Buch der Spielwelt
(The game world book)

The book contains 4 parts:


Spielwelt: Living in the game world, languages, money, gems, rules for special situations in life, view of the world
Mittelalter: The Middle ages and how was the living in the past
Pflanzen: a complete list of real and phantasmagorial plants & herbs, essential oils and poison
Bestiarium: All about the creatures


all four parts of this book have over 2500 pages!

119921.name: 5. Buch: Das Buch des Spielleiters
119921.description:
user summary

5. Buch - Das Buch des Spielleiters
(The gamemaster book)

This book contains rules summary, tables and rule additions for the gamemaster. Also a chapter over failed magic spells.
It also contains tips and tricks for a good GM.

119922.name: Motor Cars
119922.description:
Party game that tests the players' knowledge of motor car manufacturers.

Each player is given a card with 26 clues to the name of a motor car. For example;
Clue 1: A Wanderer = Rover
Clue 13: A Famous General = Wolseley

There is one cryptic clue;
A Beheaded Duck, which is meant be a (M)allard!

They are generally British cars as you might expect in a British game but two relate to American cars. I don't think many Brits would know Dodge or Plymouth.

When a guest has finished all 18 solutions, their card is handed to the host. The first to do so, with 18 correct answers, wins.

Note that this box is much larger than any other party games that I have from this era. It is also bright and colourful, another trait often missing from similar games. Unfortunately, the company must have decided that this presentation was too expensive because they soon reverted to the more traditional sized and look of most party games by their competitors.

119923.name: A Motor Smash
119923.description:
Party game that tests the guests' knowledge of car parts.

Each player receives a card with 19 clues to the name of a car part. The clues take the form of an anagram with the letters all shuffled around. Example;

TBNOEN = Bonnet (that is the Hood for American readers)
GNANDRUNOBSIR = Running Boards (that is a very nostalgic feature of a car, I think).

The guest who first hands in a correct card, wins.

119924.name: "Who Knows?"
119924.description:
Party game with 26 unusual clues to names of 26 things, each one beginning with a different letter of the alphabet, starting with A and ending with Z.

The clues are given as part of a verse. For example;

"A" is a Continent - enormously big
"B" stands for part of the flesh of a pig
"C" is a film-star, you know his face
"D" stands for a very well-known horse race
etc.

The answers to the above are;
America
Bacon
Charlie Chaplin
Derby

The first to hand in a card with 26 correct answers, wins.

119925.name: Behead Me Twice
119925.description:
Party game, unusually published as a pad with removable sheets.

On this sheet are clues to two words. However there ia third word, which is the correct answer to the clue. By this I mean, each word, beheaded (i.e. with the first letter knocked off), gives another word, and this beheaded again, gives a third word. Clues to the first word and the last word are given. The players must work out the middle word. An example;

From a shelter for horses to skilful;
First word = Stable
Last word = Able
So the middle word is Table and that is the answer a player must find to answer it correctly.

The first guest to hand in a sheet with 16 correct answers, wins.

119927.name: Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers: Mare Nostrum
boardgameexpansion: Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers
119927.description:
Mare Nostrum is an expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers miniatures game.

From publisher website :

Mare Nostrum is a 104 page pdf download detailing the Italian army from 1935 to 1945. Plenty of platoons, artillery, vehicles, and aircraft, covering everything from the Abbysinian War, the CTV in Spain, the Regio Excritorio, elite forces such as Bersaglieri and Alpini, and even Co-Belligerent forces and RSI. Also included are sections detailing several Italian enemies, including Libyans, Greeks, Yugoslavian partisans, and Ethiopians/Abbyssinians.

119928.name: Country Squares
119928.description:
Party game that tests players' knowledge of Geography.

Each guest is given a sheet of 16 clues to a territory in Europe, Asia, Africa or South America. I don't know why North America was left out, but it was. The clues take the form of three six letter words. Any two consecutive letters within each word will combine to form a six letter word answer. Example of a North American clue had North America been included;

SCARED
ANNALS
DANGER
The answer is CA NA DA so the answer is Canada

The first player to hand in 16 correct answers, wins.

119929.name: Wheels Within
119929.description:
Party game for wordsmiths.

Each guest is given a sheet with 16 clues. Each of the clues takes the form of one or two words. The clue contains the name of some vehicle or means of transport with wheels. The letters appear in their right order, but not necessarily consecutively. The number in brackets indicates the number of letters in the word answer. An example;

Revelation (3) = VAN

The first guest to hand in 16 correct answers, wins.

119930.name: A Day at the Zoo
119930.description:
Party game that has correct answers but I expect the wrong answers provide more amusement.

Each guest is given a card that tells the story of a day's outing to a zoo. However the story is punctuated with blank words and the players must hand in a card with all the missing words added correctly. Each missing word is the name of an animal. For example;

"... as slow as a t - " = Tortoise.
That was an easy one. Now try this;
"Is it going to r - ?" = Reindeer (i.e. Rain, Dear)

The first player to hand in a correct card, wins.

One in the "Dainty" series of games.

119931.name: ไดโนฟาร์ม บิวด์เกม: มาสร้างฟาร์มสัตว์ล้านปีกัน
119931.description:
English Translation title
"Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm"

The card game that be added to the educational-purposed comic-like book with same title.

You are a dinosaur rancher. Build the farm and raise the dinosaurs or reptiles from Mezoic era.

Winning the game by having the most victory point at the end of the game. The victory point is calculate at the end of game by the Farm Card and raised Dinosaur Card in the farm.

The game flow - at the start of the round, 2 Assistance cards is dealt to each player. Start from the starting player each player solves their turn by drawing 2 Dinosaur cards and play 3 actions from 4 available (Build Farm, Raise dinosaur, play Assistance card and discard and re-deal the farm card in the market). At the end of round, all player discard their Assistance cards and shuffle all Assistance cards to rebuild the Assistance deck.

119932.name: A Sterling Competition
119932.description:
A party game for wordsmiths.

Each guest is given a card with 24 clues. The answer to each clue is a word ending in 'ster'. For example;

Clue 1. Ogre = Monster
A harder one; Clue 9. Cockney Hawker = Coster

A costermonger was a person who sold things, usually fruit and vegetables, from a handcart in the street. A Cockney is someone traditionally born within the sound of Bow Bells, situated in the East End of London. However the name is often given to a Londoner born and bred anywhere in London.

The first guest to hand in their card with 24 correct answers, wins.

One of the games in the Dainty Series by this publisher.

119933.name: Foli+
119933.description:
Similar mechanism as in Folix but there is a addition instead of multiplication.

Players turn the cards face up, and find the two pawns whose product is equal to the number upon the card. The colors upon the card and pawns must also fit, which makes easy to check at a glance that the pair is correct. Some pawns do not bear numbers, but lead to special actions such as turn the board, play again, lose pawns. First to have 20 pawns wins the game.

119934.name: An Anatomical Puzzle
119934.description:
A party game for doctors (!) perhaps.

Each guest is given a card with 25 clues to which the answer is a part of the body. An example:

Clue 22. The law is credited with having a long one = Arm (as in the long arm of the law)

The first guest to hand in a card with 25 correct answers, wins.

One game in the Dainty Series of games by this publisher.

119935.name: Jugomaniac
119935.description:
Roll the dice and if one dice show the image on the card, write it quickly with your letters, in the time shown on the second dice. Pressing the buzzer and won the card!

Can be used as an educational tool as well that as a game of speed and reflexes.
Learning mode for small, mode for the biggest challenge.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner

119936.name: Primo
119936.description:
Each player has a hand of 6 cards and his turn, he will write his cards with a 'PRIMO'-word. But also some cards has special abilities: 'Star' can replace any letter or some cards make coffee break losing a turn to Your opponent.

To win the game, you have to be the first to write 4 'PRIMO' words: 'PRIMO 3' (word of 3 letters), 'PRIMO 4' (word of 4 letters), 'PRIMO 5' (word of 5 letters) and a 'PRIMO 6' (word of 6 letters), in any order.

119937.name: Nursery Jingles
119937.description:
A party game for children.

Each guest is given a score-card, with 24 clues to different Nursery Rhyme character. The clues take the form of a rhyming couplet. An example;

Clue 2. Who was the girl who once had such a scare,
A big horrid spider, her seat wished to share?
Answer = Miss Muffet

The first child to return a correct score-card, wins.

One game in the Dainty Series by this publisher.

119938.name: Fol English
119938.description:
Letter-cards are shuffled and dealt to each participant in one color. Then a word is drawn and all players try to form this word with his letters. First presses the buzzerand earn the card as a point.

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

1 game board,
80 double-sided cards,
a buzzer,
four batches of 60 letters in color duplex

119939.name: Spectacula Gladiatora
119939.description:
A hex based gladitorial combat game. You run a school of gladiators in ancient Rome.You can use chits or miniatures. The system of combat favors fast, bloody games instead of complexity and minute detail. It was designed to be familiar to role players and a entry point for casual players to become familiar with historical gaming.

The goal of the game is to win the most money by determining when is the best time to fight or use manipulation to increase your pocket book.

Each player starts with finances predetermined before playing. This amount can be changed each game to allow for shorter or longer campaigns. The players the purchases fighters for their stable, armor and can invest in creating better stats for their fighters.
In later editions the rules added a political component for multi-player campaigns.

119942.name: The Circle of Fire
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
119942.description:
From the front cover:

Surrounded by swarming giant fire ants, the end appears near and only a smoldering pyre will mark your death. Escape is at hand. Is it salvation or are you only jumping into yet another Circle of Fire?
The Circle of Fire is an adventure designed for 4-6 characters of 4th to 6th level using the OSRIC game rules. This module includes a 36-page adventure book, pre-generated characters and maps and a separate color, cardstock cover.

videogame: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Operation Desert Storm Scenario Disk
119943.name: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Deluxe Edition
videogamecompilation: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Operation Desert Storm Scenario Disk
119943.description:
User Summary

A compilation of F-15 Strike Eagle II and the Operation Desert Storm expansion disk.

The Desert Storm expansion adds eight historical missions based on Operation Desert Storm. Random missions can be generated for the Desert Storm theater, just like with the standard theaters. Certain Desert Storm missions replace the standard F-15 Strike Eagle II Maverick missiles with different air-to-ground ordnance, such as Paveway laser guided bombs, Rockeye II cluster bombs or HARM anti-radar missiles (as dictated by the target type).

Two additional theaters are added from Microprose's F-19 Stealth Fighter: North Cape and Central Europe. Night missions are now available in all theaters.

Back of Box

If you liked the first F-15 Strike Eagle, you'll love F-15 II. The classic game of aerial combat roars back to life in the '90s, loaded with fast action and vivid graphics that make Microprose the leader in combat flight simulations.

Updated with MPS graphics technology


Solid filled, polygon based 3-D graphics generate incredible visual detail
Amazingly smooth, fast animation creates the breathtaking sensation of supersonic flight
Eleven "camera" angles show close ups, wide shots, reverse angles and more
A quarter million square miles of authentic terrain in four real world battle zones provide a feast for your eyes
VGA graphics enhance the feeling of 3-D by showing remote objects through a haze that increases gradually with distance


Special options for new computer pilots


Four difficulty levels and a training mode make the game perfect for dogfighting veterans and novices alike
Optional "no crash" mode lets you try new maneuvers without risk
Optional "Director" automatically selects the best "camera angle" on the action.
Optional take offs and landings: you can start and end your missions in flight
A built-in Demo shows the basics of combat flying


Packed with more action


Dogfighting is the name of the game. The sky swarms with bogies
A streamlined weapons console targets enemy planes with the touch of a button to let you concentrate on the action
Enemy pilots and missile crews act and react intelligently. Success depends on making the right moves--fast!

119944.name: Commencement of Graduation
119944.description:
User Summary:

Jackson Tegu's entry into The Role-playing Poem Challenge. A fifteen minute role-playing game that simulates a graduation ceremony. Aside from the players (of which six are recommended) there is also an audience that observes without participating until applauding at the end. It currently exists only as a post on a thread at Story Games linked on The Role-playing Poem Challenge's entry.

119945.name: Das Neckteufelchen
119945.description:
Objective: collect cards scoring most winning points
- acting by turn -
active player turns the spinner
1 draw a correspondent card if spinner points on a symbol (8 x 4 cards + 1 devil)
2 if all 4 cards of a chosen symbol are gone ==> take the devil (out of the box or from a player)
3 if devil is yours and pointer ends on devil symbol ==> discard a card (typically with lower value)
4 it all cards are picked game ends at once - winner is player who scored most points
remarks: published early 1960's

119946.name: Flying Corps
119946.description:
Flying Corps is a 1996 World War I flight simulator developed by Rowan Software and published by Empire Interactive. It was one of the most popular flight simulators of its time due to its accurate flight models and graphics, and also the novelty factor of a First World War dog fight simulator.

The game is split in four campaigns: The Flying Circus (1917), Battle of Cambrai 1917, Spring Offensive (1918) and Hat In The Ring (1918). Several player flyable airplanes are available, including the Sopwith Camel, the Nieuport 28 and the Fokker Dr.I.

Source: Wikipedia, "Flying Corps", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of Box

"Aim for the man, not the machine."

Find out how it feels to fly and flight with the thrilling forerunners to modern fighter planes and experience the gritty realism of airborne conflict in World War I. Forget the luxury of contemporary firepower and equipment. In 1917, aerial combat was intimate, and the tools of the trade limited to a machine run, nerves of steel, sharp wits and reflexes, and chance.

Extensive research, meticulous modeling and advanced programming techniques mean unprecedented historical accuracy, breathtaking live landscapes, and authentic aircraft handling to unsettle the strongest stomachs. The result is more than mere flight simulation. Flying Corps is an exciting and exhilarating rendition of life and death in the skies of the Great War.


Rewrite history in four full blown campaigns from the allied and enemy perspective.



Join the Hat-In-The-Ring Squadron, the Jasta 11 Squadron, the Royal Flying Corps or take part in the Battle of Cambrai and attempt to better the skills and kills of airborne aces such as Eddie Rickenbacker and Baron Manfred Von Richthofen.



Feel the benefits of detailed flight models in action and discover the true meaning of adverse yaw, gyroscopic force, torque, slipstream and inherent structural integrity.



Beautifully built (and customizable) aircraft include the Sopwith Camel, Nieuport Scout, Spad XIII, Albatross DIII and Fokker DRI Triplane.



Breathtaking high-resolution three-dimensional landscapes recreated from archive material, period aerial photography and satellite and cruise missile contour data.



Believable computer-controlled pilots with artificial intelligence that learn from their experiences.



Multiple skill settings cater to novices and veterans.



Comes complete with an authentic replica pilots manual and terrain maps.


Flight sims don't get more real than Flying Corps.

Inside Box Flap

Take control of the Albatross DIII, Fokker D.R.1 Triplane, SE5a, Sopwith Camel and Nieuport Scout: Six beautifully modeled aircraft, accurate down to the smallest historical and technical detail, and with fully customizable paint schemes. Learn to stall, climb on turns, control spins, and perform maneuvers such as Immelmann turns, horizontal vrilles, side-slipping, loops and the split S. The flight models are so comprehensive you can feel the effects of the adverse yaw, gyroscopic force, torque, slipstream, and inherent structural integrity.

The attention to detail is unprecedented. This labour of love features intricate three-dimensional landscapes recreated from archive material (including period aerial photography), sound effects sampled from as many actual sources as possible, and an authentic replica of a flying manual actually used by pilots in WWI.

"Surprise is the first factor of success in aerial fighting and an ability to out maneuver your opponent the second."

Fly dozens of daring missions in full blown campaigns or rewrite history. Multiple skill settings cater for novices and veterans, and a considerate learning curve means it won't be too long before the flyers and formations are under your direct control.

The Flying Circus. The Red Baron's infamous Jasta 11 Squadron is yours to command against the Royal Flying Corps, including the formidable 56th Squadron and British ace Albert Ball. The Allied ground offensive is intensifying. Vimy Ridge has fallen and Douai airbase will follow unless you can turn the tables and match Manfred von Richthofen's success.

The Battle of Cambrai. The German defense is collapsing under the weight of Allied forces. Hundreds of tanks and troops are closing in on Cambrai, and squadrons of Royal Flying Corps are about to turn up the heat. Prove your worth as a Jasta commander: cover your ground forces' retreat, help neutralize the massive assault and initiate counter-attack.

Hat-In-The-Ring. The US Expeditionary force has unleashed its new aerial pursuit squadrons. Now it's your chance to emulate ace Eddie Rickenbacker's skills and kills. Lead the famous 94th squadron to victory and be awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor by the end of the War.

The Spring Offensive. In 1918 the Germans are making a last ditch attempt to reclaim three years of lost ground. Their tanks, aircraft and infantry are pushing hard to claim Arras and Amiens. But you, a new Royal Flying Corps pilot are going to aid the push back and help bring the War to its climax.

119947.name: Flying Corps Gold
119947.description:
Back of Box

MISSION ACCOMPLISHED

When the original Flying Corps set out in Spring 1997, Empire's aim was clear. To be the best World War I flight simulation ever.

Since then, we've been decorated for our success in the skies, with awards from leading industry names and accolades from devoted players. And now, the best flight simulation has just gotten even better, with Flying Corps Gold.

See for yourself how breathtaking new advanced add to the challenge of fighting your way through the smoke and thunder of four decisive engagements: The Battle of Cambrai, The Flying Circus, Hat-in-the-Ring, and the climactic Spring Offensive of 1918.

There are now seven classic aircraft at your command. The Fokker D-VII joins established favourites, the Albatros DIII, Fokker D.R.I/Triplane, SE5a, Sopwith Camel, Nieuport 28 Scout and Spad XIII. Extensive research, meticulous modeling and advanced programming techniques mean unprecedented historical accuracy - and bring the experience of flying these aircraft to new heights of realism and controllability.

This leaves you ready to emulate the success of real World War I aces like Rickenbacker, von Richthofen and Albert Ball.

Below you, the towns, villages, churches and copses of Northern France appear in detail never seen before, based on real aerial photographs.

Create you own battle scenarios along the Western Front using the new Mission Editor.

Best of all, you can now experience the thrills of competing with other players too - either facing them in battle or flying alongside them in squadron.

FLYING CORPS GOLD HAS BLOWN THE OPPOSITION OUT OF THE SKY. ARE YOU READY TO DO THE SAME?

Astounding 3D high resolution landscapes in 16-bit colour using DirectX

Frame rates in excess of 30fps are possible

Windows 95 Mission Editor fully featured

Supports the CH Products Force FX stick - makes play more realistic and dynamic

Single or multiplayer option including modem, direct connect, network and Wireplay for up to eight players

Customise the paint schemes on your squadron's aircraft

Landscape recreated in minute detail from archive material

Enhanced view system including a new peripheral view mode

119948.name: Buy the Numbers
119948.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of multi-classing, just to get one ability from a certain class? Perhaps you wanted to be a Rogue with a few spells, but the "Singing" Bard was not appealing. Maybe you wanted to be a nature warrior, but did not desire all the spells from the Ranger class? Have you ever wanted a mage who could rage?

Have you ever thought it was silly to adventure for weeks and weeks without ever showing improvement, but then you hit a ?magic? number of xp and BAM: all of your abilities increase? Has your character ever traveled into a new land and you asked the GM if you could try and learn the local language? But the GM had to respond "Sorry, you can't learn anything new until you get 4,500 more experience points."

Now, you no longer have to purchase libraries full of supplements, just to find a pseudo-class that suits your needs. Now you can gain skills, abilities, spells, as you go!

Instead of waiting to gain enough XP to 'level up' your character, now you can spend them 'as you go' to pick up abilities one at a time instead of en masse, allowing flexibility, customization, and noticeable improvement after every gaming session!

Get ready to change the way you think of character advancement. Get ready to have unprecedented freedom of choice! Get ready for: Buy the Numbers!

119949.name: Arcane Arsenal: Buildup Spells
119949.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first product in S.T. Cooley Publishing's new product line, the 'Shaheen's Scratchpad' line. This line consists of 'Short subject' works of about 8-10 pages focused tightly on a single subject.

Arcane Arsenal: Buildup Spells introduces a new type of spell into fantasy RPG campaigns - the Buildup spell. Buildup spells allow a caster to get a little more 'bang for his buck' when casting a spell, but the tradeoff is that the caster must wait between casting and discharging the spell. Of course, the question is: 'do you have extra time to wait?' A nice little twist for those wizards or sorcerers who want just a pinch more versatility at their fingertips. This work includes rules for incorporating buildup spells into a campaign by simply including them as new spell options or through use of skills or Feats applied to existing spells(your choice), as well as an 'in-game explanation' of the development of such spells.

119950.name: Arcane Arsenal: Jet Spells
119950.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the second product in the 'Shaheen's Scratchpad' line of 'Short subject' works focused tightly on a single subject.

Arcane Arsenal: Jet Spells introduces a new type of spell into fantasy RPG campaigns - the 'Jet' spell. A jet spell can be thought of as a ray spell that lasts several rounds, allowing the caster to hit several different targets.

119951.name: Royal Dealer
119951.description:
User Summary

Play Hearts, Crazy Eights, Rummy and Gin Rummy against one to three computer players.

119952.name: Divine Arsenal: Banner Spells
119952.description:
From publisher blurb:

Divine Arsenal: Banner Spells introduces a new type of spell into fantasy RPG campaigns - the 'Banner' spell. A banner spell creates a magical construct in the shape of a flag that 'attempt to impose the world-vision of a deity on a limited area' (i.e., they have an affect on all creatures within an area). The banner can also be used as an offensive weapon, though discharging it in this manner ends the spell.

119953.name: Divine Arsenal: Baton Spells
119953.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the third product in the 'Shaheen's Scratchpad' line of 'Short subject' works focused tightly on a single subject.

Divine Arsenal: Baton Spells introduces a new type of spell into fantasy RPG campaigns - the 'Baton' spell. A baton spell creates a small magical construct (in the shape of a baton) that grants the holder protective abilities. The construct can also be used as an offensive weapon, though discharging it in this manner ends the spell. This provides a little extra flexibility to the divine spellcaster.

119954.name: Mystic Music
119954.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is magic in music. It is subtle, yet powerful. Legends abound of songs with not just the power to move mens' souls, but to move mountains. There are myths that tell us of the minstrel who could charm audiences with a single note. Even the darker humanoids are known for their relentless war chants that spur them to greater ferocity and allow them to cover great distances without fatigue. There are tales of the singer whose voice could awaken unliving things and breathe life into them. It is even said that there are those whose mastery of music is such that they can play a song and it is heard in the outer planes, heavenly melodies and fiendish dirges.
Where are these legendary songs?

They are all here.

Countless thousands of spells have been published over the years. Wizards have long been in the spotlight and with these spells have seen their capabilities greatly expanded. Now, at long last, with the publication of The Enchiridion of Mystic Music, it's the bard's turn to have his abilities expanded.

Within this tome you will find:

A complete description of how music abilities work and what it takes to learn them
Over 100 new musical abilities that a bard can learn and use
Over a thirty new feats
Prestige Classes for bards of all stripes
Mystic Compositions - a new class of magic item
Enough 'other stuff' to make sure that this sourcbook is completely self-contained - if you have the three Core Rulebooks (the PH, DMG, and MM), you need nothing else to make total use of everything in this work!

119955.name: Treasures and Objects d'Art
119955.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Enchiridion of Treasures and Objects d'Art is 144 pages intended as a resource for players and GMs alike. In it is a system for creating truly memorable (and believable) treasures - from single distingushing pieces of equipment to exotic treasure hoards. This system for creating objects d'art has the flexibility to create literally billions of works of art, from engraved gold chalices to finely spun cloaks to weapons made of gemstone and other exotic materials.

Adventurers! Tired of lugging around endless piles of coins? Want to get equipment that makes you stand out of a crowd and be noticed? Trying to find that special signature look to make you the talk of the town?

GMs! Tired of trying to come up with exciting and memorable non-magical treasures? Wondering just exactly why monsters have piles of coins - is that all they collect from mugging passing caravans? Wondering what you can pass out to low-level PCs bored with potions and masterwork items that will be appreciated but without giving them too much power?

Inspired by those who have long told us that no monster would really collect piles of coins and magic items, this product will add a whole new dimension to the art of treasure-hunting. This of neccessity includes treatments of the Appraise, Craft, Profession, Spellcraft, and other skills... In addition, new rules for crafting items and for economic systems of communities are included.

As with all of the works in the Enchiridion Series, this work is designed to be as modular as possible, allowing seamless and easy integration of as much or as little of the material as desired. The design is intended to be literally plug-and-play: no converting existing campaign material, instead just add what you wish right into your current campaign!

119956.name: Elided Enduements of the Expanse
119956.description:
From publisher blurb:

While druids may be said to be the children of nature, or even the guardians of nature, the ranger makes no such pretension. Rangers are, at their heart, those who are simply “at home” in the wild and are able and willing to make it serve their ends. To this end, a ranger does not truly seek to bend his will to the wild; rather he tends to bend the wild a bit to serve his will. To a ranger, the wilderness is simply “home” – neither unfamiliar nor foreboding, but a place he is both familiar and comfortable with. Hence, he only disturbs it in the smallest of ways – because he only needs to disturb it in such ways. This outdoorsy approach makes a formidable woodsman, trapper, or mountaineer. The ranger is hardened by his lifestyle, relying upon none of the creature comforts that serve to make men weak, but rather the ranger is hardened and strengthened through his spartan lifestyle. Rangers tend to live by the strength of their arms and the strength of their wits (unlike druids, who gain divine power from their worship of the land). The ranger combines the tracking instincts of a wolf, the combat ferocity of a bear, and the wiles of a fox to be a formidable foe anywhere men normally fear to tread. To the ranger, the wilderness and the elements are not enemies to be subdued, but friends to be welcomed.

119957.name: Fantasy Quest Series Vol. 1: The Burning Sage's Demesne
119957.description:
From publisher blurb:

Approximately seventy years ago, Orestian, a mage of great prominence, retired to continue his study of heat, fire, and other related spells. He announced his retirement at the 23rd Festival of Fire (commemorating his defeat of a pair of green dragons which were ravaging the countryside) and further announced he would select an apprentice at the 25th Festival of Fire. He promised that his apprentice would return in to choose another apprentice at the Festival of Fire five years subsequent. This process was to continue ? every five years, his apprentice would announce the new apprentice at the Festival of Fire ? and in the event of his death, instead of announcing the new apprentice, his old apprentice would announce his death.

The 100th Festival of Fire took place two weeks ago and it has been five years since the last apprentice was chosen ? a young foreign man named Radinnal Kra?alin. This year, a new apprentice should have been chosen. But Radinnal never appeared at the festival. Concerned, the local ruler has procured a map from Resrov (the leader of the last expedition to the keep, which occurred eight years ago) and is now searching for a hardy adventuring band to go to the keep and inquire as to the state of the sage.

This critically acclaimed, award-winning adventure is for PCs of 4th level, though it contains guidelines on scaling it for PCs of 1st through 9th level.

119959.name: Fantasy Quest Series Vol. 2: Trouble in the River City
119959.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trouble in the River City is the first entry in the Fantasy Quest series since the Burning Sage's Demesne; it is a combination plate that features both an adventure module and a small city sourcebook. Trouble in the River City takes great pains to detail some of the notable areas, landmarks, and personalities of the city of Dezsket in order to set up an event-based adventure that tests both wits and strength of arms in an old-fashioned 'Sleuthing on the seedy side of town' adventure that takes characters all over this fantasy city. The adventure is intended for characters of 4th level, and features a cliffhanger ending with ample plot hooks for the GM!

119960.name: Comic Book Hero: The Greatest Cape
119960.description:
User Summary

A text-based game wherein you play a comic book writer of your own superhero.

By the maker of the Total Extreme Wrestling series Adam Ryland, Grey Dog software


Comic Book Hero: The Greatest Cape is the initial entry of developer Adam Ryland into the world of comic book characters and stories. In CBH, you take control of your chosen hero and guide him through his career, overcoming evil schemes, forming alliances and teams, creating relationships with friends, enemies and civilians, and gaining new powers and abilities along the way. There are four game modes available, allowing you can choose to either take on the story of an existing character or create your own brand new hero. Along the way you will battle villains both physically and intellectually in strategic, turn-based combat.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119961.name: Moopher's Amazing Journey to the Sea!
boardgamepublisher: Partners FOR the Saskatchewan River Basin
119961.description:
The Official Game of the Saskatchewan River Basin!

The story of Moopher begins in a gopher burrow beside a river. One day the curious gopher met a moose. They spent the day together nibbling on plants and sharing stories. The gopher was curious about the mountains the moose talked about and he wanted to go there. The moose said it was too dangerous. The gopher asked why the moose was not afraid. The moose replied that he had antlers to protect him.

That night the gopher dreamed about seeing the mountains. He even dreamed he grew a set of antlers. When he woke up he had an idea. He took the antlers from a plastic deer and taped them to his head. His friend the moose saw him and said "You are the size of a gopher but have antlers like a moose. You must be a Moopher!" Together they traveled to the mountains. One day Moopher met a trout. The trout told Moopher that all rivers run to the sea. When Moopher heard about the sea, he said good-bye to his friends and set off on his amazing journey.

Each player starts on a leaf that marks the headwaters of a river. There are three ways to help Moopher move. Each space on the board is numbered. To move ahead one space, the player must roll the exact number needed on three dice. If one die is the exact number needed, or any of the dice can be added to get the right number, the player moves. The player can also choose to play a memory game with cards or answer a river question. The first player to move their token into Hudson Bay is the winner.

119962.name: Advanced Prestige Class: Night Hunter
119962.description:
From Introduction:

There's never a priest around when you need one and even when they are they're highly unreliable. If their faith isn't strong enough you end up overrun by the vilest of creatures. Then there's the issue of dealing with the church bureaucracy just to get the job done. If only there was someone who was reliable and just as ruthless as the creatures they battle.

Finally there is. Enter the Night Hunter. This single-minded individual is not bogged down with issues of morality. Sometimes you have to break a few eggs to make an omelet and the Night Hunter is willing to do just that. The Night Hunter is an expert tracker and has an almost sixth sense when it comes to the creatures of the night. The other key to the Night Hunter's success is his versatility with weapons. Regardless of what the situation is the Night Hunter has the tool for the job and knows how to use
it.

119963.name: Advanced Prestige Class: Arcane Operative
119963.description:
From Introduction:

There are times when your everyday spy just won’t do. Imagine sending your rogue to spy at a wizard’s college or your CIA operative to spy at a witch’s coven; they would standout. Their inability to wield arcane magic causes them to be less than ideal in such circumstances.

Enter the Arcane Operative. This individual is a master of deception and the arcane arts. This combination makes for the perfect spy in any occasion.
This class can be employed in your D20 Fantasy or Modern settings.

119964.name: Happy Trails
119964.description:
User Summary

Sliding block puzzle where you guide your cowboy through the maze to pick up all the bags of money while avoiding Black Bart and the holes in the maze.

119965.name: Grand Prix Wizard
119965.description:
User Summary

A Formula One management game by Wizard Games.

Players run and manage a team, hiring drivers, developing cars. setting Budgets, negotiating with sponsors, and competing for the constructors championship.

119966.name: SVGA Air Warrior
119966.description:
Back of Box

Re-Write History.

Enter a time when pilots really flew planes...airspeed was manageable, controls were simple, nothing was computerized. Dogfight success was determined by toughness and talent, not technology.

Air Warrior lets you experience the thrill of combat in 11 of the most feared warplanes of the WWII and Korean eras. This is the training school for online air combat duty against GEnie Air Warrior veterans. The theatre of operations could have over 50 planes airborne at any time; not a welcome mat for a novice pilot.

Air Warrior is the first and only Super VGA (640 x480 x256 color) flight sim. Take to the skies in 3 modes: Beginner, Intermediate or Expert. Film your toughest missions and re-fly them differently to sharpen flight skills. Test yourself against a buddy in modem to modem airspace. But, log as many practice hours as you can; it's a wild blue yonder on-line.

World War II

The nation was committed to the war effort. U.S. factories worked relentlessly from '40 to '45 to turn out more than 250,000 planes for battle in the Pacific and Europe. Many were outdated when the war began, but held their own against superior craft until faster, more maneuverable planes arrived. Training consisted of little more than a manual, mission papers and a parachute. We were not ready for war.

Korea

The Korean War lasted from June, 1950 to July, 1953. This international military action involved the U.N., the U.S., and 19 other nations battling over Communism. Air power played a key role in the war; the very first jet-to-jet encounter occurred November 9, 1950 when an American F-80 destroyed a Communist jet fighter. MiG Alley alone resulted in the downing of an estimated 800 MiG fighters and some 58 F-86 Sabre jets. Air warfare had been completely redefined.

119967.name: Chariso Bike Rider
119967.description:
User Summary

Bike Rider is a simple scrolling race game. The objective is to avoid the obstacles while trying to get as far as you can.

119968.name: Der Schatz im Urwald
119968.description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target space (with matching move)
- moving by turn -
1 players take red route - first round
2 throw the die - ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on cover inside
3 players take black route - second round - same procedure

119969.name: Dizzypad: Frog Jump Fun
119969.description:
User Summary

Dizzypad is a platform game, you control a from and the goal is to see how far can you jump from a spinning pad.

119970.name: Fire Blob
119970.description:
"FireBlob is a charming and captivating game – you won’t be able to drag yourself away. Behind its serious facade, you’ll find a fun game that will put your reflexes and your memory to the test in turn. It is divided into 30 distinct levels, with two game modes to choose from depending on your style. Share your scores with friends around the world, and compare your achievements with theirs.

Descriptions of the game modes

Reflex Mode

In FireBlob’s reflex mode, your goal is to earn the highest number of points. To do this, you must catch the blobs that fall from the top of your sceen at varying speeds and rhythms. To catch a blob use your finger to move the vertical selection bar from left to right. If your blob hits the ground when the bar is in another lane, you won’t earn any points. If the bar is in the correct lane, however, the point will be yours. Accumulate several points in a row to nail down some bonus points and see your final score increase dramatically.

Memory Mode

FireBlob’s memory mode puts your neurons to work, letting your reflexes take a rest. Your objective is to reproduce the blobs’ descent in the order in which they fall. Pay attention, because the speed and duration of the sequences increases with each level and during each round. Passing the final levels will require total concentration."

Source: The Developer Website.

119971.name: Tass Times in Tonetown
119971.description:
User Summary

Tass Times in Towntone is a multi-platform graphic text adventure based in an alternate reality. Along with a sidekick dog, the protagonist jumps through a portal to a surreal world heavily influenced by 1980's punk culture. In this alternate world, animals can speak and deviation from the punk culture is harshly punished. The goal is to defeat the bizarre crocodile-like Franklin Snarl and rescue your grandfather from his clutches.

The interface is similar to other mid-1980's graphic adventures, with players typing commands to take actions. Certain actions may also be achieved through pressing on-screen buttons.

119972.name: Im Märchenland
119972.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space 'E'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a numbered space follow instructions of the rule sheet

remarks:
unbalanced events

119973.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 26 - Feb 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Warrant Officers: An Expansion for Military Careers in MegaTraveller
In A Store Near You: Allport-class Short Hop Cummuter Ferry (TL8)
Kurishdam: Games People Play: Old Reliables
Kurishdam: Slice of Life: Holographic and Immersive Technology
Raconteurs’ Rest: Drop Out, Part Thirteen
Up Close and Personal: Aubrey Wills
119973.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #026: February 2012

Cover: Billye Gilbert

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

119974.name: Syzygy
119974.description:
Syzygy is a tactical boardgame for 2 to 4 players in which your goal is to get three connected planets of the same colour in one straight line, without getting surprised by a Syzygy of your opponent.

In astronomy, a Syzygy is a straight line configuration of three or more celestial bodies in a gravitational system.

Online Play

Boardspace.net Real time, against humans or robot players

119976.name: Haunted Manor: Lord of Mirrors
119976.description:
Help Stan Riddle escape the Haunted Manor! After being trapped by the Lord of Mirrors, Stan needs you to guide him to safety! Use your Hidden Object skills to find valuable items and piece together perplexing puzzles. Discover why a beautiful mansion has been abandoned and what caused the owner to disappear. Come up with a clever escape plan to reach your friends in Haunted Manor – Lord of Mirrors!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119977.name: The Mall of Doom
119977.description:
From the back of the book:

In the twisted, dark future of 24th century America, heroes are needed more than ever. Do you have what it takes to rise up and answer the plea for help of hard pressed humanity? In this adventure, the characters are recruited to investigate the disappearance and whereabouts of missing townsfolk beneath the recently re-inhabited farm-fortress of Walsave. Through a series of underground expeditions, they soon discover that there is more to these kidnappings than meets the eye, and that these explorations under the Earth aren't just a ruin-crawl into the crumbling, artifact rich confines of an ancient shopping complex. Besides the pitfalls and nightmares of the subterranean hell, they must contend with conflicting interests among the villagers as well, including raiders, a bizzare cult, and the ruling founders of this fortified settlement.

Can your characters survive the challenges that await them, or will they meet their end someplace deep below the rubble and junk of a besiged post-apocalyptic village?

119978.name: Haunted Manor: Queen of Death
119978.description:
Dive into Haunted Manor: Queen of Death and save your sister before it’s too late! Find a powerful amulet to stop an ancient evil in this amazing Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. After receiving a mysterious letter, you return home to find that your family has been murdered. The only survivor is your sister, Stella, who now needs you to save her! Concoct a powerful elixir to save Stella and then confront the Queen of Death!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119979.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 6 - 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Miles to Go Before I Sleep
Six Days in the Land of Nightmares
119979.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 6)

Contents:

Features
Six Days in the Land of Nightmares - An Original Short Story By David "The Jester" Gibson
The Abber Nomads - An Anthropological Study By David "The Jester" Gibson
Knowledge in the Nightmare - Dream Quest of the Abber Nomads By Stephen "ScS" Sutton
Homeward Bound - Original Fan Fiction By Conrad Clark aka Chaos_Nomad
What Screams May Come - Nightmares in Your Campaign By Stephen "ScS" Sutton
Perilous Pursuits - Dark Dreamer By Jason "Javier" True
La Confrerie des Reveurs - A Cabal of Dastardly Dreamers By Jason "Javier" True
Miles to Go Before I Sleep - An Original Short Story By Joseph "Bela" Zettelmaier
Refuge of the Mad - Hospices and Sanatoriums of the Core By Dmitri Zorin
The Hoftmann Hospital - A Nightmarish Sinkhole of Evil By Joseph "Bela" Zettelmaier
Walking after Midnight - Sleepwalking in Ravenloft By Stephen "ScS" Sutton
Minds in the Mists - Psionics Archetypes By Stephen "ScS" Sutton

Credits
Contributors
Editors

119980.name: Quoth the Raven (Issue 7 - 2005)
119980.description:
Quoth the Raven (Issue 7)

Contents:

Features
Second Time Around - An Original Short Story By Conrad "Chaos Nomad" Clark
The Shadow Fiend - A Demon of Pure Darkness By David "Jester" Gibson
Letter of the Levkarest Temptress - An Original Story By Renee True
Needful Things - Selling your soul By Stephen Sutton aka ScS of the Fraternity
The Gentleman Caller - Evil comes Calling By David "Jester" Gibson
Demons of the Deep - An Original Short Story By Joseph "Bela" Zettelmaier
Grave, Mist and Pyre - Dread Genasi By Jason "Javier" True
Theari - Guardian Angels By Andrew "alhoon" Pavlides
Heaven Sent - A Hound-Faced Angel By Jason "Javier" True
Perilous Pursuits - Blessed Protectors By Jason "Javier" True
Children of the Night - Marcus La Monte By Tadelin Darkblade
Heinrich's Curiosities - Four Fiendishly Foul Items By Jason "Javier" True and Joseph "Bela" Zettelmaier

Masque of the Red Death
Scotty's Vengeance - The Sorrowful Tale of the Erie Board of Trade By Blake Alexander
The Grande Elizabeth - A Haunted Hideaway By Stephen C. Sutton aka ScS of the Fraternity

Credits
Contributors
Editors

119981.description:
Blast off with Sean Young's latest in the PARSEC universe, with the Parsec Expansion Kit #2: Nebulas and Nanotechs. There are new hexes, including colorful Nebulas, deadly Pulsars, and Supernovae that trigger a special “Non-Planet” scoring round, bringing research tokens and credits into play even faster. Also, there rumors abound of mysterious derelict spaceships from a long forgotten alien race that allow you to get both research and credits from exploring them..

Along with new hexes is a new Nanotech! There’s the Asynchronous Data Converter which allows you change unused AP for a turn into Credits on a 1:1 basis. Autonomous Robots allow your placed Robots to move about the board by themselves without your Ship! The Stellar Cartographer lets you draw two Space Tiles (instead of one) at beginning of your Turn. The Really, Really Big Bomb or TRRBB as it is lovingly called by many, has a dual function. It can be used to destroy Monsters, but the other, more useful evil use of the TRRBB is to eradicate relocate all of the robots on a planet.

Another exciting new feature is the addition of Faction Cards. These Factions allows players a special ability both during and after the game. Each card shows the faction’s name, the “Game Bonus” which is given during the playing of the game, and a “Final Scoring Round Bonus”, which gives a bonus during the last Scoring Round. Will you be part of the The Church of Cosmic Enlightenment, Society for Scientific Advancement, or the Hot Rods of the Gods Starship Mods? There are 8 cards, so the mix of Factions in a game will always be different!

There are plenty of new possibilities in Parsec expansion kit 2: Nebulas and Nanotechs!

Note: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of PARSEC to use it. You may also play PARSEC with this expansion kit as well as PARSEC expansion kit 1: Moons and Monsters.

Game Data:

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player commands a ship full of robots exploring the space around their declining homeworld

Game Components:

• One Expansion #2 Rulesheet
• 6 additional Space Hex Tiles
• 8 Faction cards
• 20 Nanotech cards
• 6 double-sided 3/4" Score counters
119981.name: Parsec Expansion Kit 2: Nebulas and Nanotechs
boardgameexpansion: PARSEC

119982.name: Beauty & the Beast (Intellivision)
119982.description:
Game box

Horrible Hank has grabbed Tiny Mabel and climbed the old Mutton Building. Only Bashful Buford can save her. Help him scale the building - but watch out for those falling boulders! Birds and bats swoop down on Buford, and he leaps over scurrying rats. If Buford catches a heart Tiny Mabel throws him, he becomes invincible!

Quoth the Raven (Issue 8)

119984.name: Find Your Partner
119984.description:
A party game designed to persuade your guests to mingle during the evening.

Each guest either gets a blue or red badge for their lapel. The blue badgesfeature a number. The red badges have a clue to a number. The idea is to find the clue you think that might be the answer to your number, or find the number that you think might be the answer to your clue. The first pair to 'match-up' are the winners (and, I suspect, will get a small gift from the host).

The matching pair are now partners for the evening and must partner each other for things like Novelty dances (such as the Gay Gordons).

119985.description:
The DANGER! Expansion for Dicey Curves upgrades the light, party-style dice-rolling car-racing game into an in-your-face take-that slug-fest of tactics and strategy.

The expansion adds in damage tokens, some pawns and a new deck of Danger Cards. The new cards are used to modify the track, modify players' dice rolls, and add/remove damage on cars.
119985.name: Dicey Curves: DANGER! Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Dicey Curves

119986.name: House Hunting
119986.description:
A party game intended to make "a tremendously successful party" (so says the publisher).

The host places Key Cards around the house or garden, depending on the venue for the party. For a garden party, it is suggested that you try to place the cards in unusual locations, including 'up a tree'!!

Each guest gets a card that shows, at the top, the name of a house (the British love giving a name to their house). That is their start point. They must find the Key Card with that house on it and that will tell them the name of the next house Key Card they must look for. When you find a house that you need, you must write down the defect of the house. This will prove that you did indeed find the card.

The first player to find all 12 houses required, wins.

Rather hopefully, the publisher says that if you buy extra score cards (called House Agents' Lists) up to 500 people can play! The mind boggles!!

119988.name: How Provoking!
119988.description:
A party game that tests your guests' trivia knowledge.

Each player gets a score-card, to record their answers. On the left of the card their are categories and alongside that there are 5 blank boxes. Between these two things (the category and the answer boxes) is the word 'Swaffield', going from top to bottom. D. E. Swaffield was the founder of the publisher. He designed some of its games and wrote some of the books that it published.

Swaffield has 9 letters in its name and when written vertically, it provides the initial letter required to answer the category correctly. For example:

The first category is 'Names of noted men who have written books' and the first letter is an S (as in Swaffield). The second category is 'Things in or one the sea' and these must begin with W, the second letter of Swaffield. And so on down to the last category called 'Counties in England and Wales' which will need the initial letter of D (the last letter in the word Swaffield).

The object is to write down five things that are indicated by the category and all five must begin with the associated letter. The host should set a time limit and the winner is the guest with the most valid answers.

119989.name: It's all on the Pictures
119989.description:
18 cards are placed around a room where the guests can easily see them. The guests receive a score-card, on which they will write down their answer.

The cards have an illustration which is a kind of illustrated cryptic clue. Under the picture is the item that guests must write down in their related answer. Card examples:

Card 6. A close-up picture of a tree and the subject is 'Find the Misician'. Answer = Bach (suggested by the Bark of the tree)
Card 17. A picture of a Shell oil can and the subject is 'Find the Seagull'. Answer = Petrel (the visual clue is Petrol)

I told you they were cryptic!

The first player to answer all 18 cards correctly, wins.

119990.name: Math Fun
119990.description:
Game Box

Combines fun game play with valid learning experience! Unique educational aid for elementary school children! Children compete for speed and accuracy in addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division! Animated animal figures make learning lots of fun!

119991.name: Chouchou et Loulou
119991.description:
The object is to find a word that begins with two letters.

On each card, a little phrase has a word in white. Each player or team has a few chips that show two letters. It should be the first to announce a valid word, starting with those letters, to complete the sentence. A word may be refused by a vote of players. Who complete the sentence first may remove one of his token out of his supply.
The first player who has no more tokens left wins the game

119992.name: Club voyage 2
119992.description:
Second compilation of ten games with three classics (f.e. Hangman) and seven other "unpublished" games.

The Boutamot:
An original word game, where a coil is formed of words that begin with the end of the previous word. The more we make big words, the more we encroach on the previous word, the more you score points.

The Tower
Word game with anagrams. At first we wrote a letter, then two, then three and so on. There is a phase five letters and six letters in which he must find a new word, changing only one letter. The first player who can not find the next word loses the game.

Snake Apple :
Tactical game inspired by the game of the Worms.

The Rides:
Car race on a circuit of hexagons. As in car racing on paper, you can change gears at every turn respecting a + or - 1.

The Beach
Mysterious interesting deduction game inspired by the naval battle. Five traps and three treasures are on a beach. We need to find the treasures in less than 100 blows. After each trip, the encoder indicates whether objects are nearby ... or if you jumped on a trap.

119993.name: Club voyage 1
119993.description:
There are 10 different games in this box with three classic games (f.e. the naval battle) and seven more unknown titles.

Even / Odd:
is an interesting tactical game, where players take turns to move numbers on a squares adjacent to occupied squares. The goal is to catch the opponentby playing in a box completely surrounded by occupied squares.

The crossword puzzle:
according to a original rules, each in turn wrote two more letters on a grid to score as many points as possible by lengthening words or creating new ones.

The secret message:
game of deduction and letters.

The architect:
Players move into a house of four levels, while building stairs, doors and windows. Each piece can contain only three elements. Once a player can no longer build or move, he lost the game.

The yacht race is an attempt to adapt a set of sailing race mode pen and paper. Interesting but tedious.

119994.name: Wickie und die starken Männer: Wickie und der Piratenschatz
119994.description:
Objective: get as much as possible from the gold of 'The terrible Sven' or (as Sven) protect/get back your gold
- moving/acting by turn -
1. place gold coins on the island (typically 4x number of players) - starting point: each player's drake
2. 'Sven' gets one shark for each opponent (decelarates movement), each player gets a dolphin (in his/her own colour)
3. movement: 1d6 move horizontal or vertical - sharks and other players block you, ending on your own dolphin ==> use movment points for the second time; a '6' let you move a shark and a dolphin (free of choice) additionally... get to gold island and catch one gold coin & row back
4. end of turn ==> Sven's turn: 2d6; if he catches a player with a gold coin on the sea ==> player is sent back to starting positon & looses the coin; Sven gets the coin
5. if players/Sven get back to their drakes they can store the loot safely and continue the hunt
6. game ends after last coin was safed

content: board, 5 meeples, 5 boats, 60 gold coins, 4 dolphins, 4 sharks, 2 dice, rules

119995.name: Sojourner's Way
rpgseries: AGLA - Living Forgotten Realms Aglarond Regional Adventures
119995.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The Tannath Mountains are poorly explored and even more poorly mapped. A humble cartographer seeks adventuring companions for his attempt to blaze a trail through these rough, steep spires. What would drive a man to undertake such a dangerous task? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Aglarond for characters levels 1-4 (H1 level band). This adventure is the second part of the Invisible Road Major Quest, which began in AGLA1-5 Silver Lining and will conclude in a Heroic tier adventure during campaign year 4.

119996.name: Shooting the Moon
rpgseries: EPIC - Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign Adventures
119996.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Devious plots have greatly weakened the Seldarine and nearly destroyed Arvandor and the Demonweb. Can you intervene before these machinations plunge Faerûn into havoc, ruin, desolation, and devastation? A three-round Living Forgotten Realms Epic Campaign adventure for 24th level characters.

This adventure is a direct sequel to EPIC3-3 The Tangled Skein of Destiny and the beginning of the second season of the Epic Campaign. We recommend that you play the Epic Campaign adventures in order if possible.

This is a three-round adventure. We recommend that you allow a minimum of 12-15 hours of playing time.

119997.name: Esel Lino
119997.description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your cards
- acting by turn -
1. put all five '1' cards face up into middle of the desk, take out the donkey card; all other cards are shuffled and handed out
2. each player forms a pile, cards face down
3. draw top card; if you can discard it - must match colour & must show a value of +1 (='2' in the very first moment/round) put it into the middle ==> form a pile
3a. if it doesn't match ==> form your open pile next to you... ==> next player's turn
4. draw top card; if you can discard it - must match colour & must show a value of +1 ==> desk pile (priority!)
OR ==> must show a value of +/- 1 & no need of matching colour to place on top open pile of one of your opponents
5. if your face down pile is empty turn your open pile face down
6. if active player misses an opportunity to discard or plays wrong sequence ==> gets penalty: donkey card & 1 card from each opponent
content: 100 cards numbered 1-20/5 colours

+ 1 donkey & 3 joker cards

remarks:
less enjoyable with 2 players

119998.name: Race Fans: The Card Game
119998.description:
START YOUR ENGINES!
A major corporation has come to today’s race looking for a team of drivers to sponsor. Unlike other sponsors, this corporation is not looking for a team that only cares about winning; they want a team that gets the crowd’s blood pumping with incredible speeds and daring maneuvers. A gutsy driver is just as likely to be remembered as a winning driver.
Race Fans is a family card game for 1-4 people that has players controlling a team of race car drivers trying to gain fans and win a major corporate sponsorship.

Race Fans is designed to be fast, fun, and easy to learn. The game revolves around 8 race cars in a row called the track. During the game, players use one of two different cards to affect the cars in an attempt to gain fans. Maneuver cards are used to change the position of the race cars on the track while thrill cards are used to gain fans.

119999.name: A Dozen Cleric Items
119999.description:
From publisher blurb:

This latest edition by Michael Hammes to the very popular Dozens line concerns itself with items valuable to clerics (although Paladins and other religion-based classes will find them to be of value as well).

120000.description:
Shadow Era is the physical world edition of the electronic multi-platform collectible card game by the same name. The initial (physical) release was crowd funded and contains the first set of 200 cards.

In this fantasy world of the Shadow creatures have fallen over the realm of mankind. The player assumes the role of a powerful character on either side and fights his enemies using a customized deck of cards.

Each deck contains a hero card with a different special ability and number of hit points. A player loses the game when his character's life drops to zero. Each turn players may sacrifice a card from their hand to build their resources and then use those resources to play cards or execute abilities. Cards can be allies with which to attack the opposing side, abilities such as spells and items including weapons and armor.
120000.name: Shadow Era
boardgamepodcastepisode: Shadow Era
